178501.name: OneOneOneTwoThree
178501.description:
Players are given identical hands of six action cards which they will use to manipulate a stack of two double-sided tokens (through actions such as "flip stack" and "swap tokens"). The stack starts the game in a random sequence.

Each player sets one card aside at the game's start. Then, for each round, each player chooses a card from their hand, both being revealed simultaneously. The uppermost colour on the stack determines which player's action takes effect first. When both cards have been processed, they are discarded and the top colour on the stack determines that round's winner.

The game is played over five rounds, the score for each round being one, one, one, two and three points respectively. If tied, the initially discarded cards are used to play a tiebreaker round.

178502.name: Memoria Myrana (Issue 17 - Feb 2008)
rpgissuearticle: Es liest sich was I - Der Schandfleck
178502.description:
3 Vorwort - Horstmann
4 – Ashabel – Thearch unter den Sternen Florian Wassermann
6 Ama GirRaos Kochecke – Fischfutterale Caitrina Raven, Corinna Kersten
7 Das Akip René Littek
8 – Balburri – Bringer der HarmonieFlorian Wassermann
10 – Nulqull – Nequaner der Charyptik René Littek
13 – Es liest sich was I – Der Schandfleck Dennis Rüter
15 – Xetobal – Stern der Freiheit Florian Wassermann
17 – Die Funkeldrachen Christian Saßenscheidt
20 Impressum

178503.name: Data Trails
178503.description:
From the publishers webpage:

THE INFINITE FRONTIER

The last great undiscovered country is vast, wild, and weirder than you can possibly imagine. And it’s nearby, waiting, accessible by the press of a button, or a simple gesture, or even just a thought. The Matrix holds a whole lot more than selfies and cat videos—it has artificial intelligences, electronic ghosts of people formerly alive (or perhaps still living), and deep wells of pure data that can swallow you whole. Oh, and a copy of every secret ever recorded electronically. The possible rewards of exploration are great, and the dangers are greater.

Data Trails is the Matrix sourcebook for Shadowrun, Fifth Edition, offering more options for decker and technomancer characters, including qualities, programs, gear and more.

With detailed examinations of hacker culture, information on diving deep into immersive hosts, and briefings on the strange sites hidden in dark corners of the Matrix, Data Trails is a vital resource for any Shadowrun players involved in the omnipresent flow of information. Non-Matrix specialists have chances to get in on the adventures as well, with game details explaining how their skills and expertise translate into the wild virtual world.

Data Trails is for use with Shadowrun, Fifth Edition.

178504.name: Memoria Myrana (Issue 18 - May 2008)
rpgissuearticle: Es liest sich was II – Den Göttern versprochen
178504.description:
3 Vorwort - Horstmann
4 – Baalian – Herr der Gier Florian Wassermann
7 – Die Optima Brava – Das Palastschiff des Kyrnomus ul Kouramnion Jochen Willmann nach einer Idee von Roland Hofmeister
16 – Myranor in Münster – Role Play Convention 2008 Peter Horstmann
20 - Rhacornischer BüffelreiterFlorian Wassermann
21 – Es liest sich was II – Den Göttern versprochen Dennis Rüter
23 – Codex Monstrorum – Ein Kommentar René Littek
25 – Shangamar Dennis Rüter
30 – Wege nach Myranor – Kapitän Jasteks Truhe René Littek
34 Impressum
35 – 36Gefährliche Gassen – Wettbewerb

178506.name: Unchained Monk Archetypes
178506.description:
From publisher blurb:

With the advent of the unchained monk, almost all the old monk archetypes became outdated. The changed class features simply makes most of them illegal. There are over 30 archetypes that can no longer be used! This is a fix, adjusting the old monk archetypes to work with the unchained monk class. Each has been worked over to comply with developments in the Pathfinder game. The aim has been to preserve the feel of each archetype more than to preserve every ability verbatim. A some archetypes have been extensively modified, the kata master, wildcat, zen archer, and nimble guardian.

So, without further ado, here are the unchained monk archetypes.

178507.name: The Thaumaturgic Codex III
178507.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Thaumaturgic Codex III presents 20 unique arcane spells for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game.

Several of these spells are brand new and came from the development of another project (still in the works). A few of these spells first appeared in Bloodstone's other OGL titles but have been revised, improved, and updated to the new system. Included in this collection are spells of 2nd to 9th level, such as:

Dissipation: Help your enemies be in two places at once by teleporting only *some* of them away!
Kaleidoscopic Strike: A burst of mind bending colors sends your weakest enemies to their graves. Those strong enough to survive the psychedelic trauma are left staggered and sickened.
Rainbow Force: Turn your allies into color-themed champions! Just don't let them pick their own colors. We tried that once, ended up with four guys fighting over who was going to be Mr. Indigo.
Rupture Reality: Rip a hole in the universe and cause an explosion that leaves your foes stricken and drained - if they even survive.
Shadow of Death: Conjure a crawling mass of darkness that kills the weak immediately, and kills the strong more slowly.
Waves of Force: Project a powerful force that can stop a giant in its tracks.




These and 14 other powerful sorceries await in the pages of The Thaumaturgic Codex III!

178508.name: Thus in This Age the Dracosaur Ascends
178508.description:
From publisher blurb:

A hazy massif. Its humid airs swirl over high calderas, amid volcanic peaks of shifting root. Tremors rise from far below its valleys, shaking the wary. For some heed.

Condensed to one page for slipping in among other materials, this sandbox-oriented content is intended as an easily absorbed framework for improvisation to be adapted by the user as preferred for a wider setting and specific system.

It presents core ideas and key numbers to fall back on, with general approaches that can be applied in other situations.

The content covers map generation on the fly for an abstracted massif as well as suggestions for aspects of the locality, including a people, their myth, expeditions below, fumaroles and a possible return.

The spaces within the massif could be extended using one or more of the maps in the Location, Landscape & World bundle, possibly The Great Pit, The Arid Gash and The Vermian Maze.

178509.name: Video Game Anthology vol.1: Moon Cresta & Terra Cresta
178509.description:
User Summary

Video Game Anthology vol.1 is a compilation of two shoot'em-ups: Moon Cresta and Terra Cresta.

boardgamepublisher: Greater Than Games (Dice Hate Me Games)
178510.description:
Don't Get Eated is a social game of survival of the fittest. Players take on the role of animals both working together and against each other to survive in the wilds. Failure meet the challenge presented each round results in a vicious attack, until only one animal remains standing.

In Don't Get Eated, each round will call for players to simultaneously play a numerical card from their hand. Players are attempting to meet a specific challenge stated by that round (e.g. play over a certain number, play under a certain number, etc.). Every player that plays the same numbered card is considered on a team for that round, and their played value is increased by the number of people on the team. Any player or team that does not meet the challenge is wounded, and they are closer to losing the game. Players may be knocked out (or eated) by taking multiple wounds.
178510.name: Don't Get Eated
boardgamepodcastepisode: Ep 020 – I, Geek Interviews T.C. Petty, III
Perfect Information Episode 11 – Petty Little Special

178511.name: Battalion: Nemesis
178511.description:
Publisher's Blurb:
"Battalion: Nemesis puts you in command of the Rapid Attack and Response unit commanded by Sergeant Tucker. Face off against the insidious Mullen in an epic 10 level campaign!

There are a total of 16 levels to be played, where you can master the rules of tactical turn-based strategy combat."
Source: The Publisher Website.

178512.name: Battalion: Skirmish
178512.description:
Take command of the mighty Warmachine and lead your troops to victory in the latest chapter of the Battalion saga. Battalion: Skirmish is a 1-level preview of Battalion’s improved graphics and game engine, which you will see featured in upcoming multiplayer and single-player Battalion titles this summer! In this turn-based combat strategy game, you must prevent the Warmachine, the new backbone of the Northern Federation forces, from falling into the hands of the traitor General Mullen. The Akadians are coming. Without the Warmachine, your armies will be powerless to stop them.

Source: The Publisher Website.

178513.name: Battalion: Ghosts
178513.description:
Battalion returns! In Ghosts you take control of the Akadian forces in a campaign to crush Tucker and the Federation. Play through ten campaign levels and one bonus level with three difficulty settings. You’ll get access to the fearsome Akadian Spider Tanks and Stealth Tanks in this action-packed turn-based strategy game.

Source: The Publisher Website.

178514.name: Battalion: Vengeance
178514.description:
The final chapter! Battalion: Vengeance! The Dragoons have come home to lead the final strikes on the Akadian Empire. In this turn-based strategy game, you’ll have the chance to take command of the noble Dragoons as they fight to regain their homeland. Control the Jammer Truck, Lancer Tank and Vulture Drone in your quest to defeat Durand and his Akadian cronies once and for all.

Source: The Publisher Website.

178515.name: Little Circuses
178515.description:
Step right up, step right up! The little circuses are open for business!

In Little Circuses, you'll build your big top with attractions that'll wow the crowd. Recruit sword swallowers, daredevils, and mesmerizing mystics in an effort to turn your little road show into a fixture of fun!

178516.name: The Jabberwock (Issue 1 - Apr 1982)
178516.description:
Loose mimeographed pages stapled upper-left corner.

Adventure, monsters, magic items, rules variants and considerations.

178517.description:
Black Ops is a skirmish wargame of tactical espionage combat for two or more players. It recreates on the tabletop the tension and excitement of modern action-thrillers such as the Bond and Bourne films, The Unit or Burn Notice TV shows, and the Splinter Cell and Modern Warfare series of video games.

The fast-play rules use regular 6-sided dice and a card-driven activation system to keep all players in the thick of the action, while the mission generator provides a wide range of options for scenarios, from stealthy extraction or surveillance missions to more overt raids or assassinations.

Stealth, combat and technical expertise all have a role to play, and players may select from a number of different character types – spies, mercenaries, criminals, hackers, special forces and many more – to recruit the best possible team for the job.

Players may also choose to join a faction – powerful organizations, intelligence agencies, criminal syndicates, militaries or rebel groups, each with a stake in international affairs. By doing so, their team may receive certain benefits, but may also find itself limited at a crucial time. With the variety offered by the characters, factions and scenarios, no two games of Black Ops should ever be the same!

Although the standard Black Ops setting is an ultra-modern world just a hair removed from our own, the rules are versatile and adaptable enough to suit OSS operations behind Nazi lines, Cold War-era infiltration missions in Moscow or Berlin, or sabotage runs against a rival corporation’s interests in a cyberpunk dystopia, and the rulebook will include a guide to running games in such settings.
178517.name: Black Ops

178518.name: Mariupol 2014-15
178518.description:
The game covers fighting around the city of Mariupol in south-east Ukraine, fought between the Ukrainian army and the pro-russian separatists, supported by the Russian forces.

The game was published in issue 40 of Taktyka i Strategia (Tactics and Strategy) magazine in both Polish and English editions.
Two scenarios are available:
- Mariupol 2014
- Mariupol 2015

boardgameimplementation: The Game: Drugs and the Street
178519.description:
Players are drug dealers, hustling on the mean street corners to get enough cash to become above the law. Drug crews must manage many different resources, such as drug packages, money, reputation cards, and wanted level. Real estate is everything, so drug crews have to battle it out over who gets to sling on any given corner.

Street Empire is a worker placement game where each player has three workers, or Crew pawns, to place across any of eight different spaces, or Corners. Acting one at a time, each player places one Crew pawn on one Corner. When all Crew pawns have been placed, if two or more players place their Crew pawns on the same Corner, a turf war breaks out. Players also have a hand of cards, or Rep cards, which are used to win turf wars. Rep cards have a rating and an effect, both of which affect the outcome of a turf war.

All the while, the police are watching. They are keeping an eye on how many drugs the players are selling. When a player gains a Wanted chit, he or she must now pay an additional package or money chit when buying Immunity or selling packages (to pay off the dirty cops).

Players must plan carefully to coordinate their Crew pawns, their Rep cards, drug packages, wanted level, and money to gain just enough of an edge to win. The first player to acquire three Immunity points wins the game. The only way to gain Immunity is through a Corner, which costs money.
178519.name: Street Empire

178520.name: Mokra 1939
178520.description:
Game covers battle of Mokra, one the first battle of 1939 campaing, fought between polish Volhynian Cavalry Brigade and German 4th Panzer Division. It uses "Battles of The Second World War" system.

Game was published in 40 issue of Taktyka i Strategia magazine in both the Polish and the English edition.

178521.name: Kurukuru Takopon
178521.description: A motorized dexterity game about collecting balls of takoyaki before the timer expires. Can be played either in turns, or simultaneously with scoring based on the contents of the balls.

178522.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 477 - Jun 2015)
178522.description: June 2015 issue of the longest-running APA in FRPG history.

178523.description:
Objective: be the first to get the permanent majority of votes for the coming election of the mayor - learn more about the city of Kassel

In turns, each player rolls the die, moves according the number, follows instructions of space landed on; buys, if possible and/or (preferable) votes.

"Chance" cards are created with circumstances out of the history of Kassel. Corrects answers give economic advantages.

Voting process about the next mayor: Each owned company corresponds to a number of votes. The results of each voting are kept and the final winner is the first player who reaches the target.
178523.name: Bürgermeisterspiel: Werde Bürgermeister in Kassel

178524.description:
This is a meld-building card game wherein the rules of play are the rules of Japanese syntax. The game has solo, collaborative, and competitive modes. The cards each have a Japanese word printed on them, and are color-coded by part of speech (e.g. all verbs are red).

Each card has a point value, and playing the cards according to a color pattern results in a grammatically correct Japanese sentence that awards the player points equal to the sum of points on cards played. In solo mode, the player tries to reach 20 points in the fewest amount of hands. In collaborative mode, players work together to build and improve sentences until the deck runs out of cards. In competitive mode, the points a player earns on his or her turn ("turn points") allow the player to eliminate cards from opponents' sentences or entire sentences if enough turn points are available.

This deck of Japanese: The Game differs from other decks in vocabulary and art. The vocabulary is in the theme of Japanese folk tales and mythology: sentences like "Momotaro defeated all the Oni on the island" and "The elderly woman healed her companion". This is in contrast with, for example, the Original Core Deck of Japanese: The Game that creates much more general sentences like "My dog will eat the doll" and "Your friend is fun."
178524.name: Japanese: The Game – Storyteller Deck

178525.description:
Objective: be the first to get the permanent majority of votes for the coming election of the mayor - learn more about the city of Hilden (city close to Düsseldorf).

In turn, each player rolls the die, moves according the number, follows instructions of space landed on; buys, if possible and/or (preferable) votes.

"Chance" cards are created with circumstances out of the history of Hilden. Corrects answers give economic advantages.

Voting process about the next mayor: Each owned company corresponds to a number of votes. The results of each voting are kept and the final winner is the first player who reaches the target.
178525.name: Bürgermeisterspiel: Werde Bürgermeister in Hilden

178526.description:
Objective: be the first to get the permanent majority of votes for the coming election of the mayor - learn more about the city of Höxter.

In turn, each player rolls the die, moves according the number, follows instructions of space landed on; buys, if possible and/or (preferable) votes.

"Chance" cards are created with circumstances out of the history of Höxter. Corrects answers give economic advantages.

Voting process about the next mayor: Each owned company corresponds to a number of votes. The results of each voting are kept and the final winner is the first player who reaches the target.
178526.name: Bürgermeisterspiel: Werde Bürgermeister in Höxter

178527.description:
This is the promotional character for the Coup (Resistance universe) - the Inquisitor

The Inquisitor replaces the Ambassador, and it gives the player two options:

You can either draw one card for swapping purposes (a bit like the Ambassador), or you can attack someone. Assuming the attack goes through (they can still call your bluff) the inquisitor player can look at one of their cards and either let them keep it or force them to discard it and get a new card. Both Ambassador and Inquisitor block the Captain.
178527.name: Coup:  Inquisitor Promo

178528.name: Wayfinder (Issue 13 - May 2015)
rpgissuearticle: Fear Not The Dead: Ustalavic Alchemical Items
Folk Charms of the Common People
Golarion Gazetteer: Ardagh, Bastion of the North
Heroes’ Hoard: The Knight, Soul Of Honor
A Letter to the New Investigator
Songs Heard in the Void Between the Stars
Tanjit’s Travel Guide: County Of Caliphas
The Account of the Lingering Dead
Weal or Woe: Captains of Caliphas
Weal Or Woe: Songs And Secrets
Weal or Woe: Wizardry and Witchcraft
178528.description:
From the Paizo Publishing, LLC Website:

Created for Pathfinder fans by Pathfinder fans, the cursed thirteenth issue of the ENnie Award-winning Wayfinder fanzine explores the haunted countryside of Ustalav! This free fanzine includes dozens of articles, including original fiction, new monsters, adventures, classes and options, magic items, and even PFACG scenarios—this is just a small portion of what awaits you!

Wayfinder #13 is a 88-page full-color PDF suitable for printing or viewing on your computer. It is released under the Paizo Inc Community Use Policy.

178529.description:
Objective: be the first to get the permanent majority of votes for the coming election of the mayor - learn more about the city of Alfeld.

In turn, each player rolls the die, moves according the number, follows instructions of space landed on; buys, if possible and/or (preferable) votes.

"Chance" cards are created with circumstances out of the history of Alfeld. Corrects answers give economic advantages.

Voting process about the next mayor: Each owned company corresponds to a number of votes. The results of each voting are kept and the final winner is the first player who reaches the target.
178529.name: Bürgermeisterspiel: Werde Bürgermeister in Alfeld

178533.name: Klangwerk
178533.description:
From the back of the product
Eine musikalische Reise durch Caera zur Untermalung Deiner Dungeonslayers Rollenspielrunden. Enthält ein exklusives Abenteuer für das altmodische Rollenspiel.

User translation: A musical journey across Caera to accompany your Dungeonslayers RPG sessions. Contains an exclusive scenario for the old-fashioned RPG.

Publisher blurb and track list

Klangwerk

Just play
Der Dungeonslayers-Soundtrack

Diese Audio-CD bietet eine musikalische Reise durch Caera zur Untermalung Deiner Dungeonslayers Rollenspielrunden.

Enthält neben 21 stimmungsvollen Musikstücken aus der Feder von Ralf Kurtsiefer auch ein exklusives Dungeonslayers-Kurzabenteuer für Charaktere der Stufen 5 bis 8 von Andreas Melhorn!

Tracklist:
1 Bucht von Ardell
2 Hauch der Eismaid
3 Celmas Fall
4 Nachtwache
5 Die Wüsten von Shan’Zasar
6 Freisturmtanz
7 Die Geisterreiter von Aid-Mokan
8 Erinnerungen an Nai’Antell
9 Tempel von Aldomer
10 Die letzten Tage von Lorin
11 Freie Lande
12 In den Tiefen des Hynrur
13 Die Rebellen von Kait
14 Ankunft in Meldritch
15 Falken von Wüstenwacht
16 Weisungen der Ynnari
17 Die Wartenden von Nieheim
18 Bal Darac
19 Hohen Kron – Verloren Thron
20 Die üblichen Abenteurer
21 Endkampf

178534.name: Schattenhandbuch 2
178534.description:
User Summary

Limited print edition of various SR5 pdfs.
This volume includes:
- Schattenzauber (Shadow Spells)
- Parabotanik 2075 (Parabotany, updated for SR5)
- Parageologie (Parageology, updated for SR5)
- Ätherologie (Aetherology)
- Kugeln & Bandagen (Bullets & Bandages)
- ADL Magie Update

178535.name: Game Trade Magazine (Issue 139 - Sep 2011)
rpgissuearticle: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game — A Tale of Champions Cycle
The HERO System Advanced Player’s Guide II
They Shall Not Pass: The British Battalion At Jarama — The Spanish Civil War from Osprey Publishing
178535.description:
From publisher blurb:

Game Trade Magazine is the leading consumer guide to the Adventure Hobby industry. With previews, reviews, and sneak peeks at upcoming games.

178537.name: Sails Full of Stars
rpgseries: A World of Adventure for Fate Core System
178537.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the year 1850, three empires struggle for control of the solar system: the Ottomans, whose vast Earthly empire may soon become obsolete; the Chinese, who pioneered the construction of rheoships; and the French, the new masters of alchemy. Wherever patrols are weak, pirates menace the shipping lanes. Sailors whisper rumors of dragons swimming through the black void. Fools and madmen push the boundaries of alchemy, heedless of the consequences.

Track down pirates, brave the stars, and mount shipboard battles in this Fate World of Adventure by Don Bisdorf.

Sails Full of Stars requires Fate Core to play. This 50-page supplement contains:

Descriptions of planets and spaceports to help populate a short game or a full campaign
New alchemical rules and stunts
System ideas for spaceships and space travel
Crew and rheoship combat systems
A short introductory adventure—Secrets of the Red Planet




Venture into the depths of space, where adventure and glory await!

178538.name: The Core
178538.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a full-color, 64 inch by 20 inch, floor plan of a SciFi Core, with Hex, Square and No overlay.

The Zip File includes the VTT (Virtual Table Top Images for online play).

“This spaceship’s computer core has all the data the corporations have been holding out from us about the fate of the Earth. With that data, the rebellion can prove that the corporations corrupted our initial mission of colonization in the name of profit.”—Anonymous, rebellion member

The Core is a single interior map of a large central area in a futuristic spaceship, space station, or terrestrial factory. The Core has hex-based flooring.

The Core is intended for use in far-future science fiction games.

The Origin of Man: The people of Earth fled their home world long ago to terraform and colonize planets far beyond Sol. The corporations took over the mission to Alpha Centauri from previous governments of Earth. They sealed all information about the initial mission and they history of Earth.

Legends say that the data is sealed in a computer core in the corporation’s oldest and largest space battleship. Buried in its computer core, the truth about why humanity left Earth long ago is kept secret. The rebellion wants to get the data while destroying the corporation’s largest battleship. If the information is truly damning, the rebellion can use it foment revolution throughout the system.

The group is chosen to hack the computer core for the data and then destroy the battleship by the rebellion. Will they succeed in finding and disseminating the truth?

178539.name: May 2015 Free Monster of the Month: Gravity Beast
178539.description:
From publisher blurb:

Coming to you straight from the pages of 10 All-New Space Monsters! Coming soon from Octopus Apocalypse.

"Gravity beasts appear as a tangled mass of fleshy appendages balanced delicately on the tips of its walking tentacles. Despite their lithe appearance, gravity beasts are quite strong and remarkably heavy—weighing up to a quarter ton.

The gravity beast’s most remarkable ability is the high-strength gravity field that surrounds it at all times, providing an adequate defense against all but the hardiest predators."

178540.name: Abandoned Temple
178540.description:
From publisher blurb:

Not all dungeons feature the traditional setup of a monster-filled subterranean network of rooms and passages. Woodland groves, haunted houses, druid groves and more can all serve as an exciting backdrop to the PCs’ adventures. Such locations present their own set of unique design challenges, though, for the time-crunched GM plotting the next adventure.

This instalment of Alternate Dungeons presents loads of great details, hints and tips for a GM designing an adventure set in an abaonded temple. Designed to save a GM’s time while adding flavoursome details to bring the locale alive in the player’s minds, Alternate Dungeons: Abandoned Temple is an essential tool in any GM’s arsenal. Alternate Dungeons: Abandoned Temple presents:

Abandoned Temple: An Alternate Dungeon
Abandoned Temple: Dressing
Abandoned Temple: Denizens
Abandoned Temple: Traps & Hazards
Abandoned Temple: Adventure Hooks

178541.name: Saint Fiacre
178541.description:
From publisher blurb:

Saint Fiacre is a village with a turbulent past and an uncertain future. Having weathered sahuagin raids and economic woes, the village struggles to grow and prosperity eludes its citizens. With its saintly patron now long dead, its economy is in decline and few travel to the village. On the surface, Saint Fiace rseems a relatively peaceful village, but several looming—and as yet unrecognised—threats lurk in the shadows. In short, Saint Fiarce is a village on the brink of disaster.

Village Backdrops are short, richly detailed supplements that each present a single village ready to insert into almost any home campaign. Perfect for use as a waystop on the road to adventure, as an adventure site themselves or as a PC’s home, Village Backdrop present the details so the busy GM can focus on crafting exciting, compelling adventures.

178542.name: Baden-Württemberg Reise
178542.description:
A game where 2-6 players travel through Baden-Wuerttemberg. They get between 9 to 11 city cards, must sort the cards and travel to all their cities in the best order possible. Rolling a 6 means a special acitivity card must be drawn and a detour taken. The last destination to be reached is Stuttgart, the regions capital city. First player to Stuttgart wins the game.
The city cards also contain information about each city such as its characteristics or famous sights found there.

Games from this series are also available for other regions like Hessen-Reise, Sachsen-Reise etc.

178543.name: Avalon
178543.description:
From publisher blurb:

Avalon, the isle of wonders, is slipping gradually into the mists, taking away with it forever the magic of the Old Ones. Will the People of the Wind and the old gods intervene, or will they leave their children to the mercy of the wave of invaders sweeping the Isle of the Brave? Is the future High King really their chosen one?

In this supplement for the Keltia Roleplaying Game, you will find:

The People of the Wind, the Tylwyth Teg, their powers and their king.
The Old Ones.
Avalon and Kêr Is, two sacred centres of the Old Religion.
New spells and treasures.
New creatures.
Three scenarios that can be played as one-shots or included in a campaign.
‘The Sacred Sword’, the continuation of the Arthurian campaign that began in the Keltia Core Rulebook.

178544.name: Robots
178544.description:
From publisher blurb:

All throughout the galaxy lazy people make robots do stuff, especially the dangerous stuff. Politicians find it easier to make robots kill people and break things, because robots won’t have conscientious objections when the politician wants it to do something nasty. Corporations would rather buy a robot for laborious work than deal with galactic worker treatment laws or injury compensation. Heck – a robot doesn’t have to take cigarette breaks or even sleep. It’s honestly a wonder why there are any jobs left for us flesh & blood types in the galaxy at all.

Within these pages are eleven detailed robot “creatures.” Each represents a model of robot your characters might come into contact with during their adventures. From security robots to war bots and just about everything in between, these stat blocks come complete with XP award values and even how much it costs to buy the robot yourself.

These robot models are not intended to replace the robot character class. Indeed, players should certainly use that class if they want the challenge of role-playing a robot. But for those times when you just need a quick stat block for an astro-tech bot, service bot, or protocol bot, this supplement is for you.

The Hyperspace Messenger is a series of short supplements designed for use with the White Star role-playing game, though it uses simple concepts which can easily be integrated into any OSR-style science fiction game. The goal is to deliver quality supplements exploring a single concept all within the span of only six-to-twelve pages.

178545.name: GM's Monthly Miscellany (May 2015)
rpgissuearticle: How to Handle Zero Ranks in Knowledge Skills
178545.description:
From publisher blurb:

Featuring material from some of Raging Swan Press’s newest products as well as classic releases of yesteryear, advice articles and material from Creighton’s on-going design of the megadungeon Gloamhold, the GM’s Monthly Miscellany series is a terrific free resource for the busy, time-crunched GM.

This month’s issue features:

GM’s Advice: How to Handle Zero Ranks in Knowledge Skills
Saint Fiacre at a Glance (from Village Backdrop: Saint Fiacre)
Abandoned Temple: Dressing (from Alternate Dungeon: Abandoned Temple)
Wolfsbane Hollow at a Glance (from Town Backdrop: Wolfsbane Hollow)

178546.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 5 - Oct 1975)

178550.description:
Spheres of Influence: Struggle for Global Supremacy is a 2-8 player free-for-all light wargame, set on a modern world map. Players will take control of one of the games 8 mighty factions as they compete over the world's spheres of influence, capitals and oil reserves. Will a mighty caliphate rise to power? Will the communist curtain once again fall? Or will western democracy sweep the world?

In games with fewer than 5 players, each player will control 1-4 factions simultaneously, coordinating their efforts against the other players' coalitions. Each faction will begin the game with only a single, semi-randomly determined territory under its control. From this one space, factions will aggressively expand.

The gameplay of Spheres of Influence is divided into a set number of rounds, with each round being split into 2 phases: the mobilization phase and the turn phase. During the mobilization phase, factions take turns placing units based on how powerful they are. During this phase, the global turn deck is also formed. This deck will be used to determine the turn order and frequency of action for each faction during the upcoming turn phase. To form it, each faction contributes a number of their turn cards (based on the number of oil fields they control) to a single, shared deck of turn cards. This deck is then shuffled and place down on the table.

During the turn phase, one at a time the top card of the turn deck is revealed. Whichever faction's card was just flipped, that faction takes a turn, performing a single action with its units on a single space (moving, attacking, annexing or passing). Once that action is complete, that turn ends and the next turn card is revealed, with the process repeating itself. This makes turns both fast (with many turns lasting only a couple of seconds) and suspenseful, since none of the factions know precisely when their turns will be. It also ensures more incremental game developments - factions cannot sweep across all of Asia in a single turn and players can respond to attacks or betrayals much sooner. Once the last turn card in the global turn deck has been revealed, a round ends and another round begins.

Combat is resolved by a simple dice mechanic fused with a "situational" modifier that loosely simulates the increased difficulty of attacking a defended coastline, breaking a naval blockade, or striking a fortified position. Along the way, powerful special cards can be played, allowing players to strike with submarines, deploy heavy armor, paradrop troops around enemy defenses, and launch devastating nuclear attacks.

Games have either 5 or 6 rounds depending on the number of factions. Once the final round is complete, the faction who controls the most spheres of influence wins the game for its owner. Games typically last about an hour and a half, and experienced players can sometimes finish in just a single hour.
178550.name: Spheres of Influence: Struggle for Global Supremacy

178551.name: WarAge: L'Alba degli Eroi
178551.description:
From the publisher website:
Questo manuale nasce dalla collaborazione tra Savage Worlds Italia e District Games, che pubblica il gioco di carte di Warage

English translation:
This manual is a collaboration between Savage Worlds Italy and District Games, which publishes the card game WarAge

178552.name: The Tiger's Song
178552.description:
From publisher blurb:

For the 5th edition of the world's most popular roleplaying game!

In the steaming jungles of the east, the Feathered City rises like a jewel from the lush forests. An important stop on many aerial trade routes, the skies above the city are filled with griffons, rocs, and airships from the far corners of the world. But your adventure takes you to the very belly of this exotic city. Forced into the service of a night hag, you must help her find and eliminate her enemy - a demon with no name, that rules from the shadows.

This is a mystery adventure for characters level 5-10, and optimized for a party of 5 level 7 characters. It takes about 10 hours, or two sessions, to complete.

Be warned - this isn't an adventure for the faint of heart! It contains horror elements that may be too graphic some players, and even worse - this adventure packs an old school punch. Teamwork and caution are needed to survive long enough to hear the Tiger's Song.

178554.name: Der Irrgarten
178554.description:
Objective: Be the first reaching target spaces with all (3) of your pawns precisely

Simple 'Roll & Move' game; use one die moving forward; ending on a red space: promotion; black space: move backwards. Other pawns can be passed if rolled number allows to jump, otherwise you are blocked. Pawns can't be kicked, a '6' forces you to step out of starting position and let you roll again.

178555.name: Memoria Myrana (Issue 19 - Aug 2008)
rpgissuearticle: Es liest sich was III – Hjaldinger Saga I: Glut

178556.description:
Objective: be the first to get the permanent majority of votes for the coming election of the mayor - learn more about the city of Gifhorn.

In turn, each player rolls the die, moves according the number, follows instructions of space landed on; buys, if possible and/or (preferable) votes.

"Chance" cards are created with circumstances out of the history of Gifhorn. Corrects answers give economic advantages.

Voting process about the next mayor: Each owned company corresponds to a number of votes. The results of each voting are kept and the final winner is the first player who reaches the target.
178556.name: Bürgermeisterspiel: Werde Bürgermeister in Gifhorn

Be the first to reach target space (59)
Typical 'Roll & Move' game similar to Game of Goose.
Very nice drawings/printing and - of course - pewter pawns

published ~1900
predecessor of Ein Rheinreisespiel

boardgameintegration: Shadows of Brimstone: Cynder Artifacts Supplement
Shadows of Brimstone: Cynder Artifacts Supplement
178561.description:
8 plastic doorways and a small card expansion

4 wooden beam Mine Doorways and 4 circular alien stone Other World Doorways.
178561.name: Shadows of Brimstone: Doorways into Darkness
boardgamepodcastepisode: GenCon 2015 - Flying Frog Productions

178562.description:
No one knows what has become of the ancient builders of the alien cities on the Targa Plateau! It is clear that they have been gone for sometime though, leaving the robotic Custodians and Guardians to watch over their legacy. In times of incursion, the massive Guardians awake, pulling free from their alcoves and stepping out to defend the city from intruders! Frozen over in a new ice age, the alien city has the chill of death lingering in the air and the halls echo with the sounds of the creatures that have started to take up residence there.

A single new XL Enemy with two Targa Plateau Threat Cards for Damaged Guardians and three Epic Threat Cards including one calling for two Guardians.
178562.name: Shadows of Brimstone: The Guardian of Targa XL Enemy Pack

178563.description:
Rulers of the murky swamps of Jargono, the savage Serpentmen take objection to your intrusion into their world.

The Shadows of Brimstone: Serpentmen of Jargono expansion adds the Serpentmen Warriors (6) and a Serpentman Shaman (1) as Enemies along with threat cards for both the Swamps of Jargono and the Mines.

As the Flying Frog image used here shows, it is labelled a Deluxe Enemy Set; however, the 2015 GenCon Preview was released as a Deluxe Enemy Pack.
178563.name: Shadows of Brimstone: Serpentmen of Jargono Deluxe Enemy Pack
boardgameaccessory: Shadows of Brimstone: Resin Special Enemy Grand Shaman

178564.description:
The Void is the space between worlds. When you pass through a Gate, you pass through the Void.

This set includes three of each of the Void Hound and Void Sorceror Enemy types and the Threat and Spell cards to go with them.

The Void Hounds slip in and out of reality as they move, passing through other models and savagely surprise attacking different targets each turn. This means that no one is safe from the hounds, even those hiding out in the back or around corners!

The Void Sorcerers cast random spells each round, drawn from a deck of spell cards. You draw a different spell for each Sorcerer each turn. Each card has two different effects listed, depending on whether it’s a normal casting, or was empowered by previous spells.

As the Flying Frog image used here shows, it is labelled a Deluxe Enemy Set; however, the 2015 GenCon Preview was released as a Deluxe Enemy Pack.
178564.name: Shadows of Brimstone: Masters of the Void Deluxe Enemy Pack
boardgameaccessory: Shadows of Brimstone: Resin Special Enemy Void Magus

178565.name: Over the Void
178565.description:
User Summary

Using platforms you create, you gather red triangle 'orbs' and change lights from red to green to open the gate to other abstract settings. You avoid falling into acid pits by creating platforms and rise by jumping on platforms you create above your level.

178566.description:
Gladiator or Charioteer? You choose!

Just saying the word gladiators conjures up visions of vicious combat between desperate men, who fought to the death for the amusement of the crowd. These games of death continued throughout the Roman Empire for over 900 years. Now, with Heroes of the Colosseum, you can recreate the glory and splendor of these games.

While gladiator matches were the “bread” of the “bread & circuses” that was used to placate the Roman citizens, chariot racing was the “circus”. Included in Heroes of the Colosseum, is a complete second game that lets you race chariots at the Circus Maximus.
As a gladiator or charioteer, you start your journey to Fame & Fortune far from the eye of the crowd. With luck and skill, you increase in abilities and work your way towards Rome. On the way, you will stab, slash, whip and bash all opponents who stand between you and your ultimate goal – freedom!

Inside you’ll find:
• Rules to personalize your gladiators and charioteers, making each truly unique.
• A way to generate Non-Player Opponents, totally controlled by the game mechanics.
• Two Gladiatorial Arenas, one Racing Oval, beautiful counters, and Roster Sheets to represent the gladiators and charioteers, their equipment, and horses.
• Quick to learn, but hard to master, combat and racing rules that accurately reflect the challenges of gladiatorial combat and chariot racing.
• An easy to use Campaign System, to track the success of your gladiators and charioteers, as they rise in abilities.
• Three different Locales to fight in, from the Fringes of the Empire to Rome herself, where only the greatest can gain their freedom.

In Heroes of the Colosseum, you have everything you need to do this and much more. But perhaps the best thing about the game is that it can be played solo against the game mechanics, cooperatively with all players against the game, or competitively against your friends.
178566.name: Heroes of the Colosseum

178568.name: TAKAT
178568.description:
Takat is an abstract card game of bluffing and deduction. In Takat you are secretly assigned one of four goal colors at the beginning of a round. This color will be used to determine your
score at the end of the game. On your turn, you will play a card from your hand onto the shared board and then draw a card. The game ends when there are no more cards left to play.

Points are awarded at the end of the game based on the shapes of each players assigned color. Whoever scores the fewest points wins the game.

178569.description:
CatTube Famous is a card game where you release cat videos and become the next CatTube celebrity! See the trends, release videos, get viewers, be famous!

CatTube Famous is a card game where you aim to seize global trends and release cat videos that’ll get you a massive following on CatTube. Will audiences laugh at a fat cat hanging off the curtains this month, or will it be a cat thinking “they’re people too” as they climb up on the dinner table? Read the trends, time your video releases right, and you too could be CatTube Famous!

How to become CatTube Famous:
Play Video Cards that appeal to the Trends each round. The winner of each round collects the Trend cards.

The game ends once all the Trend cards have been collected, the player with the most Trend cards is the winner and now certified CatTube Famous!
178569.name: CatTube Famous

boardgamehonor: 2015 Golden Geek Best Party Board Game Nominee
178570.description:
Incredible! The shifty thief who operates undisturbed from months is about to be caught! After copious failures, a team of detectives has a secret weapon: a witness. However this witness is quite weird; he doesn't remember anything about the appearance of the criminal, but he knows everything about their habits and behavior. Will the investigative team be able to find out the criminal only from these elements?

In Insoliti Sospetti ("Unusual Suspects"), one player is the Witness and the other players play the part of the Investigative Team. The Witness knows the real identity of the Guilty and tries to make the Team hit it only with his answers. The Team asks questions to the Witness and, depending on his answers, will exclude the innocent suspects after players have discussed what they learned.

Insoliti Sospetti can also be played competitively or collaboratively (team vs team). In the latter case, a grid of twelve suspects is created. Every round the team reveals a question card and the Witness has to answer yes/no. According to the answer, the team has to remove suspects until only the Guilty one is on the board.
178570.name: Unusual Suspects
boardgamepodcastepisode: 15. Devon Dice podcast - Pokemon, Carson City, Near and Far
Episode 89- Great Western Trail and 2017 Predictions/Resolutions
Gamer Tested - Spouse Approved - Unusual Suspects
HLG 6: Samen
RDTN Episode 92: Midnight Train to Georgia – CMON Expo, Eric Lang, Rodney Smith and Action Phase Games

boardgamecompilation: Escape: The Curse of the Temple
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Doomed
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Exchange Chamber and Teleporter Chamber
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Fountain
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Illusions
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – New Characters
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Quest
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Quest Chambers
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – The Maya Calendar
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – The Maze
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – The Pit
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Totem Chamber
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – The Cursed Gems
178571.description:
Escape: The Curse of the Temple is a real-time, cooperative game in which all players must escape from a temple after awakening an ancient curse. Players navigate through the temple by rolling dice and matching symbols to rooms, thereby gaining entry and visibility into adjacent rooms. So the temple "map" randomly unfolds as you explore further...every game is different! But as you explore, don't wander too far! All players must find the exit before the curse seals the adventurers in forever! The real-time aspect is enhanced by a soundtrack that is your timer for the game.

The Big Box Kickstarter Edition includes:
Escape: The Curse of the Temple
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Illusions (Expansion 1)
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Quest (Expansion 2)
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – The Pit (Queenie 1)
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Doomed (Queenie 2)
Escape: Adventurer Stickers (Queenie 3)
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Fountain (Queenie 4)

The following mini-expansions were also shipped to backers:
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Quest Chambers (Queenie 5)
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – The Maze (Queenie 6)
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – New Characters (Queenie 7)
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – The Maya Calendar (Queenie 8)
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Exchange Chamber and Teleporter Chamber (Queenie 9)
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Totem Chamber (Queenie 10)
178571.name: Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Big Box: Kickstarter Edition

178572.description:
Waterloo: Quelle Affaire!, designed by Alessio Cavatore and illustrated by Peter Dennis, is a hex-based boardgame that allows two players to recreate what is arguably the most famous battle in history.

The units in the game are activated by cards that represent the Commanders of the various army corps, as well as Stratagem cards that add more fun, strategy and unpredictability to the battle. These cards are full of quotes both from history and from famous Napoleonic movies: “By God, sir, I have lost my leg. – By God, sir, so you have.” or “We shall match them with our lancers!” Nobody can resist reading these with the right accent…

The challenge You win the game by destroying half the total combat strength of the enemy army. This task is easier for the French when only one army faces them. However, if Wellington’s forces survive long enough for the Prussians to finally arrive, the tip of the scale will swing in favour of the Allies, and the French are probably going to find themselves fighting for their life. And nobody can be sure exactly when the Prussians are going to appear in the East…
178572.name: Waterloo: Quelle Affaire!

178573.name: Black Knight Casino
178573.description:
From the back of the book:

Slots, cards, roulette, keno, bingo, race and sports wagering; the Black Knight Casino resort and hotel has games for everyone! Come for family fun in the arcade, bowling center, miniature golf course, or enjoy a relaxing afternoon at the movies. Finally, finish the evening with a delectable dinner in one of our fine restaurants!

Black Knight Casino is a meticulously detailed resort setting for contemporary age roleplaying games.

178574.name: Benjamin Blümchen: Ringe Tauchen
178574.description:
Children's game. The board represents a swimming pool. Before play starts, place the 25 tiles face-down, one in each square.
Players roll a colour die and may take a face-down tile related to that column or row which matches the colour thrown. If you roll a 'white' then you may choose any colour. 13 of the 25 tiles have a rubber ring on them and twelve are without a ring. When the pool is 'empty', players count up their tiles with rings and the one with them most, wins.

The 2nd game indicated in the rules is for older children. This time two colour dice are rolled together and draw the tile indicated by looking along a row indicated by one dice and also down the column indicated by the 2nd die. In addition, depending on the colours rolled, there are opportunities to give 'empty' tiles to other players or you may lose a tile you have previously taken. When all the tiles are taken, you add up your tiles with rings and subtract the tiles you have without rings. The highest total wins.

178575.name: The Tolkien Trilogy
videogamecompilation: Shadows of Mordor: Game Two of Lord of the Rings
178575.description:
User Summary

The Tolkien Trilogy is a compilation of three games set in Middle Earth: The Hobbit, Fellowship of the Ring, and Shadows of Mordor.

178577.name: Universal Adventures Adventure Module #5: Dark Water Doom
178577.description:
From publisher blurb:

People have begun disappearing. Fishing boats have been found drifting unmanned in the morning mist. More recently, a river boat, bound for the town of Ravenor, was found run aground, the crew and cargo missing. Local merchants and the Lord of the Vale have offered a reward for the recovery of the missing cargo and crew. With few clues and no idea who, or what, is behind the abductions, where will the search begin? Can your party discover the perpetrators, rescue the captives and return the stolen cargo, or will they too fall prey to the Dark Water Doom?

The next stage in the Adventrue Module series, Dark Water Doom takes you deeper into the dungeons beneath Ravenor in search of missing cargo and crew and the perpetrators behind the theft and abductions. The module includes introductory and setup information, an Adventure Record with background, start and objective information, 9 Adventure cards, 9 Encounter cards, 9 Event cards, 9 Search cards, 18 Treasure cards and 9 Forgotten Temple cards. Suitable for use with any fantasy role playing game, Dark Water Doom can be played solo or with a group, with or without a GM. The adventure is highly re-playable and compatible with other Universal Adventures cards. In addition, you can combine the cards with other cards from the series, or cards from other Universal Adventures products, to create your own adventures.

The Adventure Module is a new, simple way to play fantasy adventures. The organization and presentation of the adventures allows for quick setup, quick play and gives you the ability to focus on the action and “story” while leaving you the option to include tactical action and combat if you desire. Enter a new and exciting world of adventure, full of wonder and surprises. Gather your heroes and brave the depths of the Dark Water Doom.

178578.description: Fell is a cooperative board game pitting 2-4 players against the randomly generated Chimeris: gigantic misshapen Beasts that require many men to bring down. The players will hire a group of ruthless mercenaries, equip them carefully and then send them to hunt these gigantic Beasts. Each game will involve teamwork, strategy and risk management to focus on the most important areas of the Beast and bring it down either by taking out the head or by crippling enough limbs that it is crushed by its own weight!
178578.name: Fell

178579.description: This two-player abstract strategy game plays out an angry disagreement within the forum of a provincial town in Roman Britain. Two groups of citizens have come to blows over missing taxes, and pursue each other across the forum plaza and in its surrounding corridors. All pieces move orthogonally, with the aim being to trap their enemies while avoiding capture themselves. Capture is by blocking. Once trapped, hapless citizens are quickly dispatched (removed from the board). A Magistrate and two forum guards have wavering allegiances, and swap sides each time citizens are murdered. The two guards can also take part in capture. The winner is the player to eliminate all the opposing player's pieces. Leather board and wooden gaming pieces.
178579.name: Murder in the Forum

178580.description:
In the modern world of edible witchcraft, pizzas have replaced the standard brews as the food of choice. In this tile laying style card game, players race to collect the 20 pizza scoring tokens by completing as many pizzas as possible. But beware the ingredients’ “wicked” special abilities and spell cards that will create havoc if they become activated. When the final scoring token is taken, the game ends and the scores are tallied.

On your turn, you will play either a pizza or spell card from your hand and then draw back up to 3 cards at the end of your turn. The 55 pizza cards have a variety of different layouts with quarter and half slices on them. In order to play a pizza card, it must be laid adjacent to another card already in play and must connect crusts with another card in play if possible. When 4 sections of pizza come together to complete a pizza, 1 or 2 points are scored depending on the number of ingredients that make up that pizza; pizza scoring tokens tokens are immediately claimed. If the pizza is made up of 3 or 4 of the same ingredient, that ingredient's special ability is activated. There are three copies of 4 different spell cards that allow for additional cards to be drawn, pizza cards to be played from the discard pile, add scoring to a non-ability activating pizza, and play a half pizza section of your choice.

There are also 4 bonus scoring cards, each showing 1 ingredient, that have two abilities: 1) worth 3 points if in possession of a player at the end of the game 2) have a half pizza slice on one side that can be played onto the board instead of playing a card from a player's hand. In order to claim these cards, a player must create a pizza that is made up entirely of 1 ingredient. When that happens, that player takes the card and places it in front of them. The card stays there until either the player uses the half pizza or the game ends. However, if another player creates the same type of pizza, they steal it from whoever has it.
178580.name: Wicked Pizza

178581.description: The board game NecroVirus is a zombie apocalypse game played by 2-6 players on a 2D or 3D board with miniature figures, vehicles, buildings, chits, cards, and dice. It pits survivors in a wasted city against zombies, both of which are controlled by all of the players during the course of the game. Several missions depict rescue, last-man-standing, PvP, and vehicle use making players utilize ever-changing strategies and tactics for a successful outcome. No two boards are the same nor are the outcomes predictable right to the very end of a mission.
178581.name: NecroVirus

178582.name: No Quarter (Issue 47 - Mar 2013)
rpgissuearticle: Foundry, Forge & Crucible: In Rare Form
Modeling & Painting: Iron Kingdoms Conversion III
Skull Island eXpeditions Interview and Excerpt
The Gavyn Kyle Files: Drake MacBain
178582.description: Published simultaneous in print and PDF; contents identical.

178583.name: Moon Chronicles: Episode 1
178583.description:
Experience Renegade Kid's award-winning first-person shooter remastered in glorious 3D.

Rebuilt from the ground up to take advantage of the Nintendo 3DS, Moon Chronicles delivers an atmospheric first-person sci-fi adventure with enhanced graphics and intuitive touch screen controls for a truly immersive experience - all running at a silky smooth 60fps (with 3D on)!

Join Major Kane on a mysterious mission to Earth's moon to investigate a unique hatch of unknown origin. With each new episode you are brought one step closer to understanding the secrets that lie beneath the surface of the moon.

Episode 1 Summary
Major Kane’s investigation quickly spirals into a desperate search for lost team members and the discovery of troubling evidence.

Source: The Developer Website.

178584.name: Moon Chronicles: Episode 2
178584.description:
Experience Renegade Kid's award-winning first-person shooter remastered in glorious 3D.

Rebuilt from the ground up to take advantage of the Nintendo 3DS, Moon Chronicles delivers an atmospheric first-person sci-fi adventure with enhanced graphics and intuitive touch screen controls for a truly immersive experience - all running at a silky smooth 60fps (with 3D on)!

Join Major Kane on a mysterious mission to Earth's moon to investigate a unique hatch of unknown origin. With each new episode you are brought one step closer to understanding the secrets that lie beneath the surface of the moon.

Episode 2 Summary
Unknown Source. Will Major Kane find his lost team members beyond the second hatch? What is the peculiar “terrestrial” liquid the Kane is using to survive? What other mysteries lie beneath the surface of the moon?

Source: The Developer Website.

178585.name: Moon Chronicles: Episode 3
178585.description:
Experience Renegade Kid's award-winning first-person shooter remastered in glorious 3D.

Rebuilt from the ground up to take advantage of the Nintendo 3DS, Moon Chronicles delivers an atmospheric first-person sci-fi adventure with enhanced graphics and intuitive touch screen controls for a truly immersive experience - all running at a silky smooth 60fps (with 3D on)!

Join Major Kane on a mysterious mission to Earth's moon to investigate a unique hatch of unknown origin. With each new episode you are brought one step closer to understanding the secrets that lie beneath the surface of the moon.

Episode 3 Summary
Surprise Visit. Will Major Kane shut down the facility before he is overrun by alien troops? Is “Unkown Source” to be trusted, or is he leading Kane into a trap? The fate of the human race lies in Major Kane’s hands – is he up for the task?

Source: The Developer Website.

178586.name: Moon Chronicles: Episode 4
178586.description:
Experience Renegade Kid's award-winning first-person shooter remastered in glorious 3D.

Rebuilt from the ground up to take advantage of the Nintendo 3DS, Moon Chronicles delivers an atmospheric first-person sci-fi adventure with enhanced graphics and intuitive touch screen controls for a truly immersive experience - all running at a silky smooth 60fps (with 3D on)!

Join Major Kane on a mysterious mission to Earth's moon to investigate a unique hatch of unknown origin. With each new episode you are brought one step closer to understanding the secrets that lie beneath the surface of the moon.

Episode 4 Summary
Home Sweet Home? The thrilling conclusion of Major Kane’s lunar investigation takes him across the cosmos in search of answers to a place no human has ventured before. Will Major Kane end the alien conflict or will he fail, leaving the human race to perish?

Source: The Developer Website.

178587.name: Snowy Mountain Path
178587.description:
From publisher blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 254th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a path leading up a snow and ash covered mountain.

The map is 14 x 20 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 4 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 2016x2880 pixels in size at 144dpi.

178588.name: One Shot - Traveling the World: The Journeyman
rpgseries: The Open Gaming Store Free RPG Day 2016
178588.description:
From publisher blurb:

One Shots are simple ideas implemented over one document. They can include a new class, a new race, a family of creatures, or anything that can be explained and supported in only a few pages.

Traveling the World introduces the journeyman class to the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. Journeymen wander the world’s continents and sail its seas in search of their heroic tale. Driven by a desire to learn everything, they master several skills, discover worldly secrets, and take advantage of combat through the use of teamwork feats.

The journeyman is a hybrid class that combines the inquisitor and the rogue.

178590.name: U-BOAT COMMAND: A Solitaire Game of U-Boat Warfare during WWII.
178590.description:
BACKGROUND
U-BOAT COMMAND is a game where the Player assumes the role of a U-Boat Kommandant during WWII. As the Kommandant of a U-Boat, you are responsible for destroying Enemy Shipping and reducing the Allies Supplies. In this manner, you may shorten the war.

GAME OBJECTIVE: The objective of U-BOAT COMMAND is to sink as many tons of Shipping as possible before the War Ends. Campaigns consist of a series of Missions where, as commander of a U-Boat, the Player must attempt to score as many Victory Points (VP) as possible to assist the war efforts. Campaigns can be Short (8 Missions), Moderate (12 Missions), or Long (16 Missions).

178591.description:
You and your fellow players are architects at Luna Mare, the architectural firm planning the first base on the moon. You will compete with your coworkers for access to building blueprints, astronauts, and construction resources- all to develop the most successful moonbase!

Lunarchitects is a medium-weight strategy game that has players moving their pawns forward in a refilling circular queue to claim building blueprints. Players use the claimed blueprints to build personal moonbase plans in front of them. But instead of turns proceeding clockwise, the player furthest behind in the queue always takes the next turn. This makes blueprint choices a matter of quality over quantity.

Blueprints from four stages are shuffled then stacked, with stages increasing in both cost and power. Each time all players complete a lap of the blueprint queue, scoring occurs- and the game ends after the fourth round of scoring. The player who has collected the most points is the winner, and their plans will guide the creation the first settlement on the moon!

Unknown tile arrangement and variable scoring schemes (determined before the start) makes the game very replayable, as there is never a single most-powerful strategy.

Inspired by the well-loved game Glen More, Lunarchitects is a family game for 1-5 players that plays in about an hour.
178591.name: Lunarchitects
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 007 – Board Game Terms
Episode 7 - Glen More vs Lunarchitects
Strange Assembly 192 - Live From GenCon 2016
The Good The Board and The Jerks That Went to GenCon: Episode 78 “GenCon Reviews”
The Good The Board and The Man Who Hates All Of It: Episode 96 “Joe’s Top 10 of 2016″
Vox Republica 088: Con Season Anticipation

178592.name: After the Titans
178592.description:
Battle of Gods

The Titans have fallen to the hands of new gods. The Olympians struggle against one another for power, and now it is time for all mortals to choose sides. Which gods will you worship, Devotee? Battle one another to see whose gods are mightiest. Command beasts, summon mystical objects, and worship your gods to increase your power and cast spells to eliminate other Devotees.

Quick Review

After the Titans is a themed gateway card drafting game in a 100 card closed set.This game encompasses all the fun of deck building collectible card games, without the time investment found in similar games. Game play is designed to be brisk and competitive. The Core Set is made for 2-4 Devotees, and one game lasts approximately 5 minutes per Devotee.

Meet the Gods

The war Zeus waged against the Titans has ended. The Olympians now rule the Universe, and the Titans are imprisoned in Tartarus. Following their final victory, the Olympic gods divided the world amongst themselves and are now in a struggle against one another for power.

Apollo
Apollo is the healer. He ensures you and your Beasts can last the battle. He doesn’t just heal, Apollo keeps Beasts dealing maximum damage. He’s deceivingly good.

Ares
Ares seeks the blood of his opponents. He has the most ruthless direct and single target damage spells.

Athena
Athena is wise and patient. She counters spells, steals Beasts, and controls the minds of other Devotees. She waits until an opponent is vulnerable, then sabotages them.

Zeus
Zeus is powerful but slow to rise, making use of Favors to strengthen Beasts and Static cards. He can also fortify structures and works well with Static Cards that will be released in future expansion packs.

178593.description: The Elysium playmat has spaces to indicate how many cards to lay out based on the number of players, in addition to additional space for the temple that holds the player order tiles and Apollo's "cards from the future" layout.
178593.name: Elysium: Playmat

178594.name: Psi*Run (Italian Version)
178594.description:
From the publisher website:
Chiunque siano, ti stanno dando la caccia. Di una sola cosa sei sicuro: non si fermeranno di fronte a nulla pur di catturarti, e tu non lascerai nulla di intentato pur di restare libero.

English translation:
Whoever they are, they are hunting you. Of one thing only you're sure: nothing will stop them till they catch you, but you will do everything possible to remain free.

178595.description:
Trickster is a fun and easy-to-learn card game for 3-7 players, lasting about 15 minutes. Each Trickster set features its own heroes and new ways to play. Find the set that’s right for you... or mix together characters from different sets to customize your own game!

A Trickster set has 49 cards with seven heroes, each with their own simple effect on play. A hero appears in seven different suits, each a color of the rainbow: Red, Orange, Yellow, Green, Blue, Indigo, Violet. Each hero and suit combination appears once in a set.

The first player of each round may play any card from her hand. The second player in the round is called The Trickster, who may also pay any card from her hand. Any subsequent player that round must play a card that follows the pattern set by the Trickster. (If the first two cards are Yellow, then everyone must play a Yellow card.)

If you cannot follow the pattern, you must collect cards played this round into your personal scoring area. If everyone was able to play one card, then the Trickster collects the cards.

The goal of Trickster is to have the fewest cards by the time any player has emptied her hand. Whoever has the fewest cards is the winner... with one exception! If you have more cards of a suit than any other player, you may ignore those cards when scoring.
178595.name: Trickster: Fantasy
boardgamefamily: Guild: Game Designers of North Carolina
boardgamepodcastepisode: BGGcon 2015
Blast Off With GemPacked!
Episode 13: Starter Guide to Cons
Episode 15: Trickster, Princess Bride, Firefly, Oh My!

178596.name: #UrbanHeroes Manuale Base
178596.description:
From the game website:
Portare una maschera, nascondere il proprio volto, celare le proprie intenzioni, diventare qualcos’altro.
In Terra Z chi tenta di nascondersi dietro un simbolo vive sotto una costante minaccia: che l’Uomo dietro la maschera mostri al mondo il suo vero volto.

English translation:
Wearing a mask, hiding your face, concealing your intentions, becoming something else.
In the Z Earth who tries to hide behind a symbol lives under a constant threat: that the Man behind the mask would show its true face to the world.

178598.name: Blackout
178598.description:
From the game website:
Con BLACKOUT avrete uno scenario completamente nuovo per ambientare le avventure dei vostri H.E.R.O.es nella pericolosa Terra Z, nuovi spunti di gioco, nuove forze in campo ed un inquietante sfondo narrativo sempre più complesso e articolato.

English translation:
BLACKOUT is a completely new setting for the adventures of your heroes in the dangerous Earth Z, new ideas for the game, new forces in the field and a disturbing background increasingly complex and articulated.

178599.name: The Fifth
178599.description:
From the game website:
Prima che il BLACKOUT sconvolgesse Terra Z, prima che gli Eoni facessero il loro ingresso nella nostra realtà, un gruppo di comuni umani si stanno godendo una rilassante crociera a bordo della lussuosa Felicitas, nave di punta della famosa compagnia Amerigo.

English translation:
Before the BLACKOUT upset Terra Z, before the Eons came into our reality, a group of common human are enjoying a relaxing cruise aboard the luxury Felicitas, flagship of the famous Amerigo company .

178600.name: The WitchBorn: Starter Set
178600.description:
The WitchBorn is a miniatures rules game that lets players build war clans to clash in a post-apocalyptic fantasy world. Here, no one dies any more: they just rise again as WitchBorn.

Players build a war clan of 8 Dwarves, Elves, Guild, Norn, Orcs, or Paladins. Your war clan participates in a true “campaign game” with an expanding series of adventures. Each adventure has its own 46” x 39”battlemap depicting an exotic locale. The Chase is the first, and comes with the Starter Set.

An airship crashes in the Kasel Plains, jettisoning potentially valuable cargo. Each player leads their war clan in a search for the treasure—but needs caution. The once gentle centaurs of the plains are all WitchBorn now. Smart phone apps take the place of a game master, guiding players through a variety of random encounters.

Once a war clan escapes the battlemap with the airship cargo, players adjust their rosters. The war clan roster is the central tool that allows warriors to level up and change after each adventure. Players spend money they earn to choose from hundreds of items to equip their war clans. The roster tracks changes, so players can watch their characters develop from inept beginnings to their rise as dominant heroes.

178601.name: Ender of Fire
178601.description:
User Summary

Pick a class and battle hordes of monsters.

178602.name: Storm Of Steel
178602.description:
A centuries long interstellar war leaves survivors of the two factions stranded on a planet, fighting each other as well as internal foes and the two indigenous people of the planet.

Storm of Steel is a sci fi skirmish miniatures game derived from Shieldbash. Each trooper has a simple profile but they fight quite differently from one another. The activation system used in Shieldbash and Shieldwall gives fast turns with unpredictable swings of initiative. Leaders, cavalry, skirmishers, medics, comms, area affect weapons, exotic melee weapons and more are included. The Shieldbash system means figures don't simply trade die rolls until someone runs out of hit points; instead troopers move around the battlefield as they are pushed back or dodge of weapons fire, and infiltrators appear seemingly out of nowhere.

Four included scenarios give a variety of tactical objectives to fight over, and a campaign system allows linking scenarios into Tales, with fighter progression between them.

178603.name: Particula (Windows/Macintosh)
178603.description:
User Summary

A series of negative emotions assault your peace of mind, which you destroy with 3 defense structures. Upgrade the defenses to three levels of power and fine tune them within with upgrades.

178604.name: Alien Uprising: Cliff/Corner Crash Map Pack
178604.description:
Both the Cliff Crash and the Corner Crash maps provide alternate crash site scenarios for Alien Uprising.

Cliff Crash
The idea behind Cliff Crash is, the right edge of the board acts like a natural shield for the crew of the Pioneer (the crashed space ship); but this is also a curse, as the number of spaces they will have to move to get to debris will be so much farther away!

Corner Crash
Similar to the Cliff Crash, the Pioneer is naturally shielded on the crash site. However, the far corners of the crash site are really difficult for the crew to reach!

Both maps greatly increase the difficulty of the game and should be considered "advanced" scenarios.

178605.description:
Tropes: Horror Story Edition the ever-changing party game of improvised storytelling and horror movie clichés. Tropes will quickly get the whole room laughing as you and your friends and family use the cards to tell a story using stereotypes from classic horror movies.

Will the Jock make it out of the Cabin in the Woods? What will the Camp Counselor find in the Wood Chipper? And what horrors are in store for the Prom Queen at the Abandoned Motel?

Tropes - Horror Show Edition is a cooperative story telling game. 2-6 players use story cards to create a hilarious horror story. When a player sets down a finale card, one of 12 characters meets their untimely demise. The player then claims that character card as a point, the player with the most character cards wins!"

"Tropes is for ages 13+ and can be played in about an hour. The great thing is that story cards can be played an infinite amount of ways, leading to stories that are always different
178605.name: Tropes: The Horror Story Edition

178606.name: A Place to Fuck Each Other
rpg: A Place to Fuck Each Other
178606.description:
From the PDF

A Place To Fuck Each Other is a game about queer women and the relationships they tentatively build within new spaces. The spotlight moves through a cluster of lovers as they play slice-of-life scenes about hooking up and moving in. It’s a game about hope, disillusionment, and attempting to create healthy queer spaces.

The game is for three players. Roles rotate, but in every scene two people will play Lovers and the final person will play the Third. Scenes are about tacit negotiation between the Lovers and the Third, between expectations and realities.

This is a game about queer women—whether gay or bi, butch, femme, trans, not. But it’s also about the spaces held by a specific group of queer women. Life is long, gender can surprise us, and for this reason you might find your story occasionally making space for people who no longer identify as women, or don’t yet, or who have muddled relationships with queerness, and just—know that all of these stories have a place in this game.

178607.name: Farben und Formen
178607.description:
Educational game for the under 10's. Each player is given a board with 9 large squares on it. Each square has a shape in it, diamonds, circles, etc.. Tiles are revealed one by one and the children have to recognise the shape and if it fits on their board. First to find their nine shapes, wins.

There are variants on this theme that can be used depending on the age of the children.

The boards and tiles are incredibly sturdy, better than games made today.

178608.name: The Making of Savage Worlds
178608.description:
From the Introduction of the pdf

This article was originally written as the game was being developed. It was then updated and annotated in 2004, about a
year after the game debuted in March of 2003. The “Updates” you see are from this 2004 version. A condensed and edited article written for the Shark Bytes Fanzine appeared sometime in 2006 as well.

178609.name: "Not Another One!"
178609.description:
“Not Another One!” is a light print and play dice game where all players use the same dice rolls and same grids.

On a turn, roll the single dice and write the result into your grid. You have to roll the dice 9 times in order to fill the grid arranging the numbers so that, when added together in vertical and horizontal lines, you match the target numbers in the circles.
If you’re successful you get 5 minus points, but if your sum stands above or below the target number then you receive penalty points.

The player who has the least amount of points after three rounds is the winner!

All you need to play is:
x1 dice
Print out of the board for each player
Pen or Pencil

178610.name: Terrible Lizards
boardgamepodcastepisode: TRCP Launch Episode 9
178610.description: In Terrible Lizards you build your own dinosaur and fight against the reptile of your opponent. All actions including the dino parts are represented in the play of cards.

178613.description:
Star Trek: Five-Year Mission is a cooperative dice placement game for 3-7 players who take the roles of crew members of either the USS Enterprise (from the original Star Trek series) or the USS Enterprise-D (from Star Trek: The Next Generation). Each crew member has a different ability and the crew’s abilities differ for each crew.

In these roles, players try to cooperatively solve a series of blue (easy), yellow (medium) and red (difficult) alerts to score points, attempting one of 6 different difficulty levels to win before failing five such alerts, or the Enterprise being destroyed. Players must deal with injuries which lock dice out of play, ship damage that can force players to attempt harder alerts, urgent events that must be completed in 3 minutes, the prime directive, as well as yellow and red alerts that force additional alerts cards to come into play pushing you closer to failing.
178613.name: Star Trek: Five-Year Mission
boardgamepodcastepisode: 1P 086 - The 7th Continent and Lewis & Clark
Episode 215 - I'm a Doctor, Not a Dragonslayer
Episode 62: The New Beginning
Episode 64- Tail Feathers & 2016 Predictions/Resolutions
MN 0081 Star Trek: Five Year Mission
Spike
Vox Republica 101: We've Been Sabotaged!
Vox Republica 102: Gaming On A Budget
Vox Republica 105: Low Down Dirty Cheaters

178614.name: Café Olé
178614.description:
There's chaos in the café! Countless customers are waiting hungrily for tasty cakes, cookies, sweets and drinks while Ole, chef of the café, is thinking about retiring.
In the shoes of the relentlessly working café staff the players are creating fancy cakes and pies and everything else the customers are ordering. If they are busy enough to fill the whole load of orders before closing hour is there, Ole will be satisfied enough to retire carelessly and one of the players will become the new chef of Café Olé!

Café Olé is a cooperative game in which the 1-6 players:

Reveal the topmost order-tile from the stack
Use their dice-cards to gather 3-6 dice
