Roll their dice to gain the right ingredients for the open orders
Try to gain all open order-tiles before the closing-hour-tile is drawn




That's it and it's a lot of fun. But beware of the "Special Treatment" and "Complaint" tiles!


German description
Im Café Olé ist die Hölle los! Unzählige Gäste warten hungrig auf feine Leckereien und zu allem Überfluss will Ole, Chef des Cafés, auch noch in Rente gehen.
Schlüpft in die Rollen des eifrigen Café-Personals und bereitet leckeren Kuchen, köstliches Eis und kalte und warme Getränke zu. Wenn ihr besonders fleißig seid und die Flut an Bestellungen abarbeitet, kann Ole beruhigt in Rente gehen und einer von euch wird der neue Chef des Café Olé!

Café Olé ist ein kooperatives Spiel, in dem die 1-6 Spieler:

Jeweils das oberste Plättchen vom Bestellungsstapel aufdecken
Ihre Würfelkarten nutzen um 3-6 Würfel werfen zu dürfen
Die Würfel werfen um die richtigen Zutaten für die offen ausliegenden Bestellungsplättchen zu erwürfeln
Insgesamt versuchen, alle offen ausliegenden Bestellungen abzuarbeiten, bevor das Ladenschlussplättchen aufgedeckt wird




Das ist schon alles und macht eine Menge Spaß. Aber passt auf die "Extrawurst-" und "Beschwerdeplättchen" auf!

178615.name: Hideous Creatures: The Great Race of Yith
178615.description: [Publisher Blurb] "As mental barriers wore down, I beheld great masses of thin vapour in various parts of the building and in the streets below. These steadily grew more solid and distinct, till at last I could trace their monstrous outlines with uncomfortable ease." From unguessable aliens to cone-shaped librarians to beetle-conquerors, the Great Race of Yith takes many forms. Learn to recognize them, before they take yours!

178616.name: Crawl! (Issue 10 - Aug 2014)
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
178616.description: Alternative classes for demihuman races; a variant multi-classing system; random physical traits; and three weird races.

178617.name: Quests of Doom (Pathfinder)
178617.description:
From Publisher Blurb:

What happens when you take some the best adventure writers in the world, and set them loose to assemble a book of masterpiece-level challenges for players? Quests of Doom, that’s what happens!
This book is packed with 18 adventures in over 300 pages, by acclaimed and award-winning authors Ed Greenwood (The Forgotten Realms Campaign Setting, The City of Splendors),Bill Webb (Rappan Athuk, The Lost City of Barakus), Matt Finch (Swords & Wizardry, Tome of Adventure Design), J. Collura (Caverns of Thracia Reloaded, Chaos Rising), Michael Curtis (The Dungeon Alphabet, Realms of Crawling Chaos),Casey Christofferson (The Tome of Horrors, City of Brass), Steve Winter (Tyranny of Dragons, Murder in Baldur’s Gate), James M. Ward (Gamma World, Pool of Radiance, Castle Keeper’s Guide), and Skip Williams (Axe of the Dwarvish Lords, The Rod of Seven Parts).
Containing some of our older adventures (Demons & Devils and Vampires & Liches), and a vast array of new ones, your players will be pitted against the craftiest and most sinister adventure-writers we could find, to give you more of our Adventures Worth Winning!

178618.name: Crawling Under A Broken Moon (Issue 4 - Oct 2014)
rpgissuearticle: The Earth Brain of the Cyberdrive
The Might Kitzz - the Intergalactic God of Rock and Roll
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
178618.description: Intergalactic god, many-headed hydra, patron objects, twisted menagerie. More strange craziness.

178619.name: Crawling Under A Broken Moon (Issue 5 - Dec 2014)
rpgissuearticle: Castle Oldskull and the Masters of Aetheria
Forgotten Tech of the Un Men
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
178619.description: The Kingdom of Aetheria, new character class, newly discovered tech, the dark lands, Castle Oldskull, and twisted menagerie

178620.name: Rescuer Game
178620.description:
A little girl is left alone on the topn of a burning hill and the fire is raging. She is in danger! the rescuers must climb up to the top of the hilltop to save her as fast as possible. But, the mission is not easy. They must watch out for the burning wood and be careful not to lose their way on the hill. Otherwise they will be slowed down, while the time is running out!! The perfect dice game for little ones.

Game-play:
Each player takes turns to roll a multi coloured dice, then move their rescuer to the next space on the board which matches that colour. If a '?' is rolled, that player must draw a card from the deck and follow the instructions; e.g move forward/backwards x spaces, swap places with another player etc... If a player lands on a fire, they miss a turn while they extinguish the flames. The first player to get to the top of the hill, rescues the little girl and is declared the winner.

178621.name: Deal Corner
boardgamecompilation: Deal: American Dream
178621.description:
Deal Corner is a quick game of arms trafficking in which you need bluff and memory in order to control a corner!

Deal Corner uses 50 weapon cards and 60 one million narcodollar bills.

A game is divided into two phases: the traffic phase, when players try to get the best weapons; and the combat phase, when they use these weapons.

The objective of the game is to survive the confrontation while saving up the maximum amount of bills.

All the components needed for a game of DEAL Corner can be found in the Deal: American Dream's box. Also available separately in the Kickstarter.

178622.name: Blackout: Journey into Darkness
boardgamepodcastepisode: BGA Ep. 94 - Suburbia vs. The Castles of Mad King Ludwig
TRCP - Launch Episode 10
178622.description:
Blackout is a post-apocalyptic dungeon crawler for 1-4 players. Players take control of one or more characters and venture out into the Northern Wastes in search of glory and renown. Blackout is a mission-based leveling system that offers savage combat and rewarding exploration.

Blackout is designed for solo and co-op play. In addition, Blackout missions can be presented by a gamemaster if the players wish to experience a more narrative adventure. Blackout offers 15-20 hours of play.

178623.name: RPG Review (Issue 26 & 27 - Dec/Mar 2014/2015)
rpgissuearticle: Crew of the Damned: Piratical Pregens
Deep in the Ivory Tower: A Runequest Pirates Adventure
Pirate Enounters for Gulliver’s Trading Company
Shab Al-Hiri Roach Review and Scenario
Some Thoughts on The Wheel of Time
The Pirates! Band of Misfits Movie Review
178623.description:
RPG Review
Issue #26 - 27
Pirates and Swashbucklers Double Issue
December - March, 2014 - 2015

178625.name: Globe-Trotter
178625.description:
The goal of the game is to get with all four pawns into one sector (II, III, V, VI) of the game board. The first player to achieve this wins the game. If a player gets three pawns in an sector, all other players have to vacate this sector. Placement and movement of the pawns is determined by two dies, a standard die (1-6) and a degree-of-latitude-die.

A second game rule is for a travel game, where the players are to get their pawn from their starting point (colored dot on the game board) to three destinations (determined by the draw of 3 "Orts-Karten" and back to their starting points. On the roll of a 6 the Player has to move his pawn and draw a "Zufalls-Karte" and follow the printed instructions on the card.

178626.name: Deus Machina Demonbane
178626.description:
User Summary

An action mecha visual novel with Cthulhu Mythos elements and small amounts of eroge content. Play as the private detective Kurou Daijuuji, hired to find a magic book. Through your search you meet a girl who is actually a grimoire and activate a powerful mech known as Demonbane.

178627.name: No Quarter (Issue 48 - Mar 2013)
rpgissuearticle: Modeling & Painting Challenge: From the Deep
Mysteries of the Maiden: Convergence of Cyriss in the RPG
Tales of the Iron Kingdoms: Conversion
The Gavyn Kyle Files: Iron Mother Directrix
Tournament Triple Thread: Convergence of Cyriss
Warmachine Model Previews: Convergence of Cyriss
rpg: Iron Kingdoms Full Metal Fantasy Roleplaying Game
178627.description: Released simultaneously as print and PDF editions. Contents identical.

178628.name: Phoenix Force
178628.description:
User Summary

As a phoenix you shoot various enemies (eyeballs, death) to advance on the map from encounter to encounter. While you fire constantly, enemy attacks burn one colour and then another as they become active. The game is challenging, for while the enemy takes many many hits to destroy, you can be destroyed with one touch of an enemy attack.

178629.description:
Pocket Imperium: Prosperity adds yet another layer of strategy to Pocket Imperium's minimalist gameplay. You must now guide your star empire to take advantage of changing new opportunities appearing across the galaxy.

At the beginning of the game, players set the Prosperity cards face-down in a row, which represents the new opportunities and bounty available to those who dare seize them.

Each round of the game, the next round's Prosperity card is revealed, allowing for players to plan to occupy specific systems, raise fleets or take over Tri-Prime, all of which reward the player with additional points.

Each card will also reward players with additional actions, depending on if they played a command card at a certain time in their turn, representing certain actions being more efficient due to market conditions.

Prosperity is meant for those who are looking for more of a "gamer's game" out of Pocket Imperium. It is appropriately sized for a microgame, and offers additional choices at both the tactical (action timing) and strategic (changing goals for bonuses) levels.
178629.name: Pocket Imperium: Prosperity

178630.name: Don't Scramble The Egg Game
178630.description: Diary of a Wimpy Kid - Don't Scramble The Egg Game. Can you take better care of the egg then Greg did in health class? Turn over a category card and read it out loud. Then start the timer on the egg. After you call out an answer to the category, toss the egg to another player. Act fast because you never know when the egg will splattttt! If that happens when you're holding the egg, you collect a card. And if you collect 3 of those, you are out of the game.

178631.name: Pitiri 1977
178631.description:
User Summary

The whole world resembles the 1970s, with its haircuts, music, and general graphical atmosphere, except that your brother has been taken by aliens, although that may be a 1970s trope also. You get sucked into an alien world from a tube in the playground and jump through platform levels starting up machines, taking polaroids for save points, and collecting triangles.

178632.name: Audiosurf 2
178632.description:
User Summary

Audiosurf 2 is the sequel to the 2008 game Audiosurf. It features new game modes and several customization options, as well as support for user-created game types and skins.

boardgamecompilation: Antietam: The Bloodiest Day, 17 September 1862
Cemetery Hill: The Battle of Gettysburg, 1-3 July, 1863
178633.description:
SPI published soapbox size wargame consisting of 9 copies of Antietam and 9 copies of Cemetery Hill both games from their Blue & Gray series. There is an additional teachers instruction booklet, 2 historical briefings booklets, two test questions booklets and one Bulletin board poster to promote the class activity, the entire collection can be used for teaching in the classroom.

The game is extermely rare.
178633.name: Conflicts in American History: The Civil War Module 1

178634.name: Rook's Keep
178634.description:
User Summary

An action combat game that can morph into a dueling game or melee skirmish against AI or other players. It can also make a game of either classic or combat chess. There is (or was) a dedicated server by the developers but its existence seems fragile.

178635.name: No Quarter (Issue 49 - July 2013)
rpgissuearticle: Guts & Gear: Blighted Nyss Legionnaires & Swordsmen
In Battle Forged: Walking the Knife
Stone & Steel: Rhulic Warcasters & Warjacks in the RPG
The Gavyn Kyle Files: Wurmwood, Tree of Fate
Warmachine Tactics: The New Faces of Warmachine
rpg: Iron Kingdoms Full Metal Fantasy Roleplaying Game
178635.description: Print and PDF versions published simultaneously with identical contents.

178636.name: No Quarter (Issue 50 - Sep 2013)
rpgissuearticle: Foundry, Forge & Crucible: The Cutting Edge
In Battle Forged: Lessons of War
The Gavyn Kyle Files: Lord General Coleman Stryker
178636.description: PDF and print version published simultaneously. Contents identical between both versions.

178637.name: King's Reign: Solitaire Card Game
178637.description:
Similar to Blackie's Maze in style, this is a game where you must adventure out and create farms, forts, jacks, and queens to protect your king, who is the center of it all.
Build farms to supply more men for you to create. Build forts to disrupt your enemy's path. Create jacks for you to combat the enemy with.
The goal is to discover all the possible cards and get the most points. The two ways to win are 1, discover all cards, or 2, not have enough cards left to battle an enemy.
Use a basic card deck without jokers to lay out your yet to discover kingdom, and claim rule to your land.

178638.name: Homesick
178638.description:
Explore an abandoned building, encountering puzzles and clues as the story unfolds. You seem to have been there so long that direct sunlight is blindingly bright, at home in the serene but foreboding atmosphere. But when you sleep, you are plagued by nightmares, frantically running down hallways chased by darkness, an axe in hand.

Find the remnants of the building's inhabitants to discover who you are, what happened, and what you need to do, as you try to escape in both your nightmares and the waking world.

Homesick is a puzzle exploration mystery game with a first person perspective, in a richly detailed and atmospheric 3D environment. Incredible live-instrument original score included as an mp3 album.

Source: The Game Website.

178639.name: 8-Bit Gangster
178639.description:
Step into the role of a mafia don in the midst of a brutal mob war. Employing an army of wiseguys and shady tricks, you must eliminate all the other mob bosses. The prize? Absolute control of the criminal underworld.

The game is played utilizing dice rolls and cards. Each player draws action and unit cards. The unit cards are used to take over property cards, where they can then attack other players' unit cards by rolling dice. Each unit has bonuses and detriments that will alter the roll. Each player can also play action cards to aid their attack or impede the other players. Well balanced between chance and skill, players can often come back from the brink of losing to win the game.

http://www.8-bitgangster.com/
https://www.facebook.com/eightbitgangster

178640.description:
Objective: Gain most victory points by bringing home as many of your pawns (geese, ducks, chicken, young chicken) as possible - or as fox: catch many them.

Roll & Move Game, best with (4) 5 players

All players move around the same board like Pachisi; board is divided 10 segments with 6 spaces each. Payers are forced to start with a second pawn as soon as the first has left first segment. After a complete round a turnable fox (in the centre of the board) is spun - the segment he's pointing on is in danger: each involved player has a saving throw escaping into next segment - otherwise the pawn is caught by the fox. Depending on order of running in victory points are granted. Slight modifications with 4 or 3 players.
178640.name: Rette sich, wer kann!

178641.name: Cyborgs: Earth Twin I
178641.description:
Cyborgs vs Earth Crew.
With Earth's depleted resources and overpopulation, another planet must be found to support Human life, and time is running out. One of 11 teams of space explorers, Earth Crew's mission is to travel to Kepler-452b, Earth Twin exoplanet, and confirm potential support for human life.

But first the Crew must survive.

On entering Kepler-452b atmosphere, Earth Crew are attacked by Cyborgs, who invaded the planet already, merging with many of its primitive humanoids. Cyborgs have taken over communications with Earth and they're coming for the Crew.

Who will defeat the other in a battle for survival of their species, and domination of the Earth Twin planet?

Choose a side, Cyborg or Human, then trek your way through Kepler-452b terrain, fighting opponents, encountering strange Humanoids and plants, before taking over the opponent's command centre.

Cyborgs game is a unique sci-fi strategy game, both cooperative and competitive. The goal is to beat your opponent team and dominate the planet.

178642.name: This Mundane Life
rpgseries: RPG Geek Fiasco Playset Contest 2015: Mythical / Supernatural
178642.description:
User Summary:

Players create havoc in a dystopian world when their mundane characters see supernatural things and are sent to the Charon Rehabilitation and Investigation Clinic for four weeks of therapy. Rebels, weirdos, secret police, and wannabe normals must find their sanity or embrace the madness... and mandatory termination compliments of The Eye.

178643.name: Fantasywelt (Issue 11 - 1986)
178643.description: Issue #11 contains the usual mix of articles and gaming material (adventure, trap, NPC...) and reviews.

178645.name: Magical Spell
178645.description:
Six brave fourth-graders join forces to protect the playground from the tyrannical Dark Prince Ipal, but only one of them can be crowed Spell Master. Overcome treacherous obstacles and defeat the evils of recess by spelling!

In Magical Spell, you create words to earn dice, which you use to overcome enemies and obstacles.

On your turn, players will assemble Letter Cards to create words. Each letter grants the caster dice. The more rare the letter, the more powerful the die. To defeat encounters, players must exceed or match a combat value. Defeat the enemy and gain victory points. Fail and take wounds.

Magical Spell includes a deck of Letter Cards which also grant special abilities. Use F to create fire spells, or H to heal. The game is played with a polyhedral set of dice and invokes the feel of a light dungeon crawl set in the imagination of elementary school kids.

178646.name: Rolltennis
178646.description:
Objective: gain penalties - as little as possible - by flipping a rotor through a gate

Build up a gate on a table - flanked by a skittle and a backstop on each side. Use a curved needle to flip the rotor through the gate to opponent's side - avoid to hit a skittle/backstop; otherwise collect a penalty and try again. First player gaining 20 penalties has lost the game.

Note:
This game was invented in Germany before the Second World War. Based on the tools/materials used, one of the possible German publishers before WWII could be Mieg.

178647.name: Jr. Rangerland FickleFish
178647.description:
In this unpredictable game, each roll determines if you catch a fish, choose a fish from another player, give up a fish or if the fish gets away.

Contains 23 Cards; each with their own point value and facts about the fish.

The most points wins the game.

178648.name: MusiQwiz
178648.description:
A quiz game about the music stars and their music. You will be on a musical travel from under the sea to the air - and beyond to the Universe!
First to get out of the "King of Rock'n'Roll" field win and become the the MusiQwiz (Music Wizard)

The backside of the board contains shorter version of the game.

178649.name: På Rejse i Alverdens Viden
178649.description:
Quiz race the board have five different "districts" from Start to Finish divided by orange paths;
On the orange paths you use the die to move, and some spots have question mark.
When coming to the the coloured districts you drop the die and only move when answering questions depending on the difficulty of the question (if you guess wring you can only move one space).

First to finish is the winner.

178650.name: Gynophobia
178650.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




Gynophobia is a shooter about the abnormal fear of women. The story follows Mark, who is suffers from a number of different phobias.

178651.name: Zeit²
178651.description:
Zeit²™ is a traditional side-scrolling, 2D, shoot-’em-up game that brings unprecedented elements to the game experience. Zeit²’s unique time travel feature has yet to be seen in this genre even after decades of great games.

Intuitive controls allow players to move forward and backward in time making it possible for the player to combine shots and power, and even be assisted by a shadow version of yourself. Blast away swarms of enemies, get the highest score and discover how you can assist yourself in new exciting ways by warping time at will.

Source: The Publisher Website.

178652.description:
Iconic Heroes is the latest release in the Pathfinder Battles series of pre-painted plastic miniatures from WizKids Games and Paizo Publishing.

Iconic Heroes Set 1 includes six all-new miniatures featuring legendary characters from the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game universe:

Valeros, Iconic Fighter
Seelah, Iconic Paladin
Seoni, Iconic Sorcerer
Sajan, Iconic Monk
Lini, Iconic Druid
Droogami, Snow Leopard Animal Companion

Each Iconic Heroes set also includes exclusive Cards (one for each miniature) for use in the Pathfinder Adventure Card Game! These special Cards are only available in this Pathfinder Battles product!
178652.name: Pathfinder Battles: Iconic Heroes Set 1

178653.description:
Iconic Heroes is the latest release in the Pathfinder Battles series of pre-painted plastic miniatures from WizKids Games and Paizo Publishing.

Iconic Heroes Set 2 includes six all-new miniatures featuring legendary characters from the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game universe:

Amiri, Iconic Barbarian
Ezren, Iconic Wizard
Kyra, Iconic Cleric
Merisiel, Iconic Rogue
Harsk, Iconic Ranger
Biter, Badger Animal Companion

Each Iconic Heroes set also includes exclusive Cards (one for each miniature) for use in the Pathfinder Adventure Card Game! These special Cards are only available in this Pathfinder Battles product!
178653.name: Pathfinder Battles: Iconic Heroes Set 2

178654.description:
Iconic Heroes is the latest release in the Pathfinder Battles series of pre-painted plastic miniatures from WizKids Games and Paizo Publishing.

Iconic Heroes Set 3 includes six all-new miniatures featuring legendary characters from the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game universe:

Alahazra, Iconic Oracle
Damiel, Iconic Alchemist
Imrijka, Iconic Inquisitor
Alain, Iconic Cavalier
Balazar, Iconic Summoner
Padrig, Eidolon

Each Iconic Heroes set also includes exclusive Cards (one for each miniature) for use in the Pathfinder Adventure Card Game! These special Cards are only available in this Pathfinder Battles product!
178654.name: Pathfinder Battles: Iconic Heroes Set 3

178655.description:
Panzer Battles: 11th Panzer on the Chir River, is a Standard Combat Series (SCS) game by Multi-Man Publishing and covers the classic mobile defensive Chir River Battles of the German 11th Panzer Division against the culminating point spearheads of Soviet Operation Uranus. The Soviets have successfully entombed the Stalingrad Pocket and are in the process of locking down the pocket even harder.

In December, 1942. Strong Soviet forces, including the 1st Tank and 5th Mechanized Armies, conducted a concerted attack against German positions in an attempt to block relief efforts directed at Stalingrad from the west. In what is considered a masterpiece of mobile defensive warfare, the German 11th Panzer Division fought a lightning series of ‘fire brigade’ battles to contain and beat back the efforts of the Soviets to further seal the Stalingrad Area west of the Don Bend.

In an interesting twist of events, the German 11th Panzer Division, recently arrived from France is preparing to take part in the northern portion of the German relief attempt on Stalingrad (Operation Winter Storm). Full strength and available, the division launches into the Soviet drive in what has become a textbook example of a mobile defense and counter-attack which is studied to this day. It originated the term 'Fire Brigade' as used on the Eastern Front in WW2.

Under the energetic leadership of Generalmajor Hermann Balck and his Chief of Staff Oberstleutnant von Mellinthin, the 11th Panzer was able to defeat the Soviet mechanized drive.

German accounts stop right there, with a German victory. However, the win (if it can be called that) was a Faustian bargain. The Soviet drive was stopped, but at the cost of the German units designated to make the Stalingrad relief effort. There would be no Northern Pincer now. The Southern Pincer soldiered on alone. And failed.

The game covers all this swirling mobile action in turn representing two to three days and a hex scale of 500 meters. Units are companies to regiments. Play is highly interactive (the only way to show its mobile nature) using a chit pull system by formation. The rules are a continued adaptation of the system shown in Bastogne: Screaming Eagles under Siege, It Never Snows, and Day of Days: The Invasion of Normandy 1944.

Scenarios (4 scenarios total, 2 one-map scenarios):

Panzer Battles Campaign, 2 maps and 7 turns.
Containment Battles, 2 maps and 6 turns.
State Farm 79, 1 map and 2 turns.
"I'll be back", 1 map and 2 turns.




Game Scale:
Game Turn: 2-3 days
Hex: 547 yards / 500 meters
Units: Company to Regiment

Game Inventory:
Two 22 x 34" full color map
One dual-side printed countersheet (280 1/2" counters)
One 8-page SCS version 1.8 system rulebook
One 12-page Panzer Battles specific rulebook
Two 6-sided dice

Solitaire Playability: Medium
Complexity Level: Medium
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 2-10 hours
178655.name: Panzer Battles: 11th Panzer on the Chir River

boardgamecompilation: Abyss: Key Monster Tokens
Bohnanza: Bean Market
Cacao: Big Market
Cacao: Big Market & Golden Temple
Cacao: Golden Temple
Carcassonne: Winter-Edition – Die Kornkreise
The Castles of Burgundy: 6th Expansion - The Cloisters
Catan Scenarios: Santa Claus
Colt Express: North Pole Station
Doctor Panic: Klaus Santa
El Gaucho: Fodder for the Cattle
Fields of Arle: Advent Calendar Expansion
Die Glasstraße: Die Adventskalendererweiterung
Isle of Skye: From Chieftain to King – Brettspiel Adventskalender Promo Tiles
Las Vegas: The Slot Machine
Loony Quest: Bonusplättchen Skier
Marvel Dice Masters: Avengers vs. X-Men - Hawkeye: Avengers Disassembled
Orléans: Christmas Market
Power Grid: High-Voltage DC Transmission Passage C
Rokoko: The Festivity Dresses
Splendor: Special Noble Patron
Targi: The Action Tokens
VivaJava: Al Gusto - Promotableau NR. 1
Wizard: The Christmas Wizards
ZhanGuo: Brettspiel Adventskalender 2015 Expansion
Zooloretto: Skunk
178656.description:
Brettspiel Adventskalender 2015 is pretty much what the name says it is: A board game advent calendar for 2015. It contains 24 small expansions for 24 different games, from 21 different publishers.

The game rules are not included, but are posted separately on the publisher's web site, on each day from December 1st to 24th.


Catan Scenarios: Santa Claus - Give Santa Claus 1 wool as a gift and you can set him on any landscape to get a gift token for any Settlement or town (or 2 tokens on Santa's house). If you give him 2 wool, he can expel the robber. 2 gift tokens can be exchanged for a resource.
Fields of Arle: Advent Calendar Expansion - Included are 3 German language tiles giving the following Abilities:
Torfbrandziegelei: Immediately (and only after building this Peat-Fired Brickworks), per Shovel you have, you may exchange 1 Clay and 1 Peat for 1 Brick.
Torfkraftwerk: When you build the Peat Power Plant (and only that once), you can remove any number of Moor Tiles from your Home Board. For each Moor Tile that you remove via this ability, you receive 2 Food. (Also remove the Peat from the Moor Tiles, if any.)
Vierspänner: 1 Triple Space for Vehicle Actions (bigger version: 1 additional Single Space). Like Double Spaces, the Triple Space cannot hold tiles that are smaller than the space (e.g. you cannot place Linen there). In the bigger version, you can cover both the Triple and Single Space with one tile of size 4.

Colt Express: North Pole Station - Included is a single Train Station card. At the end of the game, each Bandit gives his highest purse to the imp.
Las Vegas: The Slot Machine - Included is a seventh casino. The slot machine is treated as the seventh casino, using the same rules as the other casinos, with the following three exceptions:
Dice placed on the slot machine can show any number, 1-6.
A player must place all dice of one number. However, the number on the dice must be different than the numbers already on the slot machine.
If two or more players have tied for the most dice placed on the slot machine, the winner is the player whose dice have the highest sum. If that players’ dice have the same sum, the player with the higher single die wins first choice.

Bohnanza: Bean Market - Included are 48 quarter bean dollar (QBD) tokens. At any time on your turn, you can buy exactly one card from the bean market. These rules apply:
The front card on the bean market costs 1 QBD, the second card is 2 QBDs, the third card is 3 QBDs, and so on.
During the "Trading and Donating“ phase, you may trade the chance to buy a card from the bean market to another player.
When you buy a card from the bean market, you have to plant it immediately.

Loony Quest: Special Item - Included are 1 alternative score token, 1 alternative character token, and 4 bonus tokens. A player who has a Ski tile may discard it during the scoring step and place his score token behind the score token of the nearest opponent on the score track.
Doctor Panic: Klaus Santa - Included is an exclusive and limited patient card.
Rokoko: The Festivity Dresses - Included are 4 Festivity Dress tiles. The Festivity Dresses are manufactured like the normal Dresses. However, they cannot be sold. Once made, immediately and only this once gain Prestige Points.
Zooloretto: Skunk - Included is a single animal tile of a skunk. The first player who fills his 6-space enclosure takes the Skunk enclosure as a bonus. Once owned pay 2 coins to discard all tiles of one animal type from your barn as an additional action. In turn order all other players may then pay 1 coin to the bank to purchase 1 of the discarded tiles and add it to their zoo.
Orléans: Christmas Market - Included are a Christmas Market tile and 2 20 coin tokens. In addition a single six-sided die is needed. When you activate the Christmas Market, roll the six-sided die. The result determines the bonus you will be getting.
Glass Road: Advent Calendar Expansion - Included are 1 Immediate and 3 Bonus building tiles giving the following effects:
Umbau: Immediately place this building on top of one of the Start buildings “Forest Glassworks” or “Brotherhood of the Masons”. The Rebuild is worth 3 points.
Einfriedung: * 4 points if you have no empty spaces left on your Landscape board at the end of the game.
Christkindlesmarkt: * 1 point per Bonus building on your Landscape board.
Gaststube: When you build the Guesthouse, immediately use a Processing building on the Building board.

Targi: The Action Tokens - Included are 8 Action tokens. The Action tokens offer the players new possibilities:
Joker goods token: A player can choose to use his/her Joker goods token anytime as 1 good of his/her choice.
Targi token: When both players have placed their Targi figures, a player may place his/her Targi token on any free Border card. This can even be a card opposite of the other player’s Targi.
Tribe marker token: When both players have placed their Tribe markers, a player may place his/her Tribe marker token on any free intersection, which is on an unbroken direct line from the Robber and also one of his Targi figures.

Abyss: Key Monster Tokens - Included are 5 Key Monster tokens. When a player draws a Key Monster token he puts it open in front of him. It counts as key to take control of Locations.
VivaJava: Al Gusto (Promotableau Nr. 1) - Included are 4 Ability Discs giving the following abilities:
Sweetener Scandal: Return a Flavor Die to the supply to force another player to discard their Blend.
Creamer: On another player’s Roll, return a Token to force that player to re-roll all their dice.
Lukewarm: Return a Token to the supply to force another player to degrade their Featured Blend by one bean.
Ability Swap: Return a Token to the supply to swap the location of two Ability Discs on the Main Coaster.

Wizard: The Christmas Wizards - Included are 4 wizard cards. If you‘re playing Wizard between Thanksgiving and Christmas, the Christmas wizards are stronger than the regular wizards, so they always beat them to any trick. The last Christmas wizard to be played in each trick wins it.
Splendor: Special Noble Patron - Included is 1 noble tile. This noble tile can be used in any game of Splendor.
Cacao: Big Market & Golden Temple - Included are 2 jungle tiles, namely a market with a selling price of 5 gold and a temple with 8 gold for 1st place and 1 gold for 2nd place.
Zhanguo: Brettspiel Adventskalender 2015 Expansion - Included are 3 Task tiles and 1 Wall tile.
Marvel Dice Masters: Avengers vs. X-Men: Hawkeye: Avengers Disassembled - Included is 1 card. Once per turn, during your Main Step, you may knock out a Hawkeye die you control. If you do, you may deal damage equal to his attack divided any way you choose to your opponent’s characters.
The Castles of Burgundy: The Cloisters - Included are 5 cloister tokens. Each round, place one cloister (in place of a black-backed tile) onto the central black depot. A cloister can be bought from the central black depot for 2 Silverlings, and is then placed onto an empty storage space. A cloister can then be placed onto an empty space in the player’s estate that is adjacent to at least one previously placed tile and that matches the number on the player’s die.
El Gaucho: Mini Expansion: Fodder for the Cattle - Included are 8 Feedbag tokens. On your turn, you can use one of the two dice you chose to take a Feedbag. Each time you sell a Herd, you can discard up to 2 Feedbags. For each Feedbag you discard, you can increase the value of the most valuable Cattle Tile in the Herd by 1.
Isle of Skye: From Chieftain to King: New Scoring Tiles - Included are 2 Scoring tiles. One provides 3 VPs for each horizontal line of at least 3 contiguous land­scape tiles in the clan territory. The other provides VPs for one of your scrolls. If the scroll is in a completed area, you receive double the VPs for it.
Carcassonne: Winter Edition: Corn Circles - Included are 6 landscape tiles. When a player draws a corn circle landscape tile, he first places the tile according to the basic rules and completes a normal turn. Then, he chooses one of the following for all players to do:
Place a follower from his supply on a tile where he already has a follower.
Remove a follower from a tile and return it to his supply.

Power Grid: High-Voltage DC Transmission Passage C - Included are 6 transmission line tiles. Germany plans a new high-voltage transmission line from North Germany to South Germany. In this mini-expansion you are building this transmission line, so step by step your power companies do not need to pay connection costs anymore between Cuxhaven and Stuttgart. Sadly, the construction of this transmission line is paid with tax money, so you must pay taxes for supplying cities with electricity.
178656.name: Brettspiel Adventskalender 2015
boardgamepodcastepisode: Essen 2015 - Board Game Advent Calendar

178657.name: Transformers
178657.description:
The Autobots and the Decepticons are at war, trying to occupy newterritories and set up bases across planet Earth!

Be the first to capture four territories by leading your Autobots or Decepticons into battle. As Commander, it’s your job to pick the most powerful Robot on each territory.

As an attacker choose a territory you think you can conquer with the Robots in your hand. Choose the Robot (or pair of Robots) that you want to use to win that territory and place them face down on the table. When both sides have played, turn over your Robot cards, count your power ratings. The highest score takes the territory.

Every Robot has two power numbers and Special Skills shown by the colours on his card. If your Robot’s skill colours match all the battle skill colours needed on that Territory, use the large number as your power rating. If they don’t, or you don’t have all the colours, the smaller number is that Robot’s power rating this turn. The highest number wins.

178659.name: Troll Magic
178659.description:
From publisher blurb:

Discover the Magic of the Trolls!

There are many different approaches to magic, and different groups are able to master it in different ways, creating strange and exotic spells that others would never dream of. Trolls are no different in this regard, and while many of the trolls in the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game are not very well inclined towards magic, trolls in other fantasy media are rife with strange, primitive rituals and shamanistic traditions, the flavor of which we attempt to capture with the spells in this book.

This book contains 11 new spells for a wide variety of spell lists, all of which are thematically linked to the primitive (but no less effective) magic of trolls. Burst of vigor can grant powerful regeneration in combat, or improve the target’s existing regeneration, but comes at the cost of weakening the target when the spell ends. Create cave allows you to create an extradimensional cave from any rock surface, an ability especially useful for victims of the curse of sunstone, which causes the target to be petrified in direct sunlight. Perhaps the most potent troll spell, heart regrowth allows creatures with regeneration to remove their still-beating heart and hide it away somewhere, allowing them to regenerate from their heart rather than their corpse, should they die.

Whether you’re looking for unique and exciting spells for your trolls or similarly savage NPCs, or just want to expand your wizard’s ever-growing spellbook, the magic of trolls is not to be overlooked!

178660.name: 2018: The War for Hell
178660.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Last Book in the "Hot Chicks" Line!

Things got bad for humanity in 2015; Aliens, Demons, and Human Greed threatened to put all of mankind of the dinner plate. Only those brave enough to take up arms and fight for the future and destiny of all mankind have stood between humanity and total horrific exploitation.

In 2018, the stakes get higher. Alien spacecraft rain from the sky and the powers that be discover that the threats to the Earth now threaten all of existence and reality itself. The very structures of the Universe are threatened, and there's only one thing to do.

If there's going to be a tomorrow, then the adventurers of the Earth must band together with their most hated enemies and make a stand in Hell itself. It's all or nothing; defeat a horrible enemy that will stop at nothing to end the Universe, or say goodbye to existence.

One thing's for sure; either way, this is going to be EPIC.

This book brings the product line of Hot Chicks: The Roleplaying game to an end, but not the story. If all goes well, and there IS a tomorrow, then it will be time to take up the battle for the Future and Destiny of mankind in the near future. Will YOUR Hot Chicks Characters be able to stand up and say they fought the War in Hell to make way for the future of Destiny 2025?

178661.name: The Swashbuckler
178661.description:
From publisher blurb:

There’s no shortage of individuals that strike out in search of gold and glory. Most aren’t particularly concerned with how they get it: the important thing is that they get it, and they survive long enough to enjoy basking in fame and fortune.

Not you.

Yeah you want both, but you want to earn them in style. It’s not enough to merely slay the dragon and get the gold, possibly even fame. There’s gotta be a chase, a cleverly sprung trap, a narrowly-avoided demise—something for you and the other survivors to boast about when they limp back home.

Through sword and wit, loathsome monsters, dastardly villains, and even your companions will bear witness to your deeds. They’ll spread your name through fearful whispers and boisterous tales.

This product contains two separate pdf files. The first is a digest-sized, 23 page book laid out like the Dungeon World rulebook. It includes:

The Swashbuckler, a complete class with 20 advanced moves: improve your fighting technique, goad enemies into fighting you, attract a sidekick, and more!
New equipment like parrying dagger and buckler, as well as some firearms if your campaign features them.
Two new magic items, including an artifact: do what it wants, and it'll become more powerful!
Seven moves that just didn't quite make the initial cut.




A kind of behind the scenes look at some of the fiction and other content.

178662.name: The Vaults of Obryn Sapravda (1E)
178662.description:
From publisher blurb:

Not long ago, a powerful wizard, seeking a remote location from which to conduct his experiments, set off into the wilderness with a team of dwarves and trusty servants. A suitable location was found, deep in the mountains, and construction began, expanding the old ruins found there. Messages were sent to the various schools of magic, informing them that the great Obryn Sapravda, Master of the Animative Arts, was almost ready to open his research laboratory, and would be taking petitions from wealthy families to apprentice their children.

But then all correspondence ceased. The dwarven laborers were dismissed, but would say nothing of what had happened to the great wizard, nor would they reveal the location of his laboratory in the mountains. Rumors began in the circles of wizardry that Master Obryn had delved too deeply into the dark arts, and that he had gone insane. Others suggested that he had summoned a creature from beyond the pale, only to become its slave, still others that his animated constructs had gone berserk and torn him to shreds. No one seemed interested in the truth, all were content to accept one rumor or another, and soon the once powerful wizard faded from memory.

But now the long lost abode of Obryn Sapravda has been found! Your band of brave adventurers has been hired to explore their depths, and learn the fate of the legendary mage. Your mission is frought with secrecy and intrigue. Can you unravel all the mysteries of The Vaults of Obryn Sapravda?

Inside you will find:

Complete room descriptions with new monsters, traps, treasures, and more!
Complete floor plans for every room and encounter area!
Several puzzle encounters to test your players skills and wits!
Three separate scenarios, with twenty unique encounters! Play all three as one long adventure, or divide them up and drop them into your campaign.
FREE 3-dimensional map set (included within) of every room in 1" = 5' scale!
No need to fumble thru generic tiles to create each encounter, simply print and play!

178663.name: The Burbling Bog Scents the Change in the Air
178663.description:
From publisher blurb:

A murky bog. Its miasma hangs in the glittering thickets and creeps over pans crusted from viscous mucal sumps, secretions of the living mounds lying deep within. Crust-cutters enter to strip the pans for fertiliser; scuttlers breed. The claggy land shifts, snorts. It sniffs...

Condensed to one page for slipping in among other materials, this sandbox-oriented content is intended as an easily absorbed framework for improvisation to be adapted by the user as preferred for a wider setting and specific system.

It presents core ideas and key numbers to fall back on, with general approaches that can be applied in other situations.

The content covers map generation on the fly for an abstracted bog as well as suggestions for aspects of the locality, including beings present, thickets, sumps, mounds and spaces below.

The subterranean networks could be simplified or extended using one or more of the maps in the Location, Landscape & World bundle, while the secretions and fluids could be detailed using Elaboration: Atmosphere & Liquid.

178664.name: Great the Change as Greatly They Know
178664.description:
From publisher blurb:

An overgrown cloister. The outlandish thicket in which it stands springs from walls encrusted with blooms of crystal, phenomena studied by an order ensconced within. They too are transforming.

Condensed to one page for slipping in among other materials, this sandbox-oriented content is intended as an easily absorbed framework for improvisation to be adapted by the user as preferred for a wider setting and specific system.

It presents core ideas and key numbers to fall back on, with general approaches that can be applied in other situations.

The content covers map generation on the fly for an abstracted cloister as well as suggestions for aspects of the locality, including growths, occupants, rooms, volumes and physical changes.

A possible source for the phyme is given in For the Tears of Stars are in Full Flood. The cloister could be simplified or extended using map elements from Landscape: The Manse.

178665.name: By Water's Mirror
178665.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Pathfinder/3.5 Compatible Adventure for 4-6 PCs of levels 2-3

The lost domain of Vargon Greyhand’s has been found. The PCs are tasked with exploring this forgotten dungeon. What starts as a foray to solve a mystery and to claim long abandoned treasures soon proves to be quite different. You are not the first to adventure in these halls, and indeed you are far from alone now.

The PCs will seeks answers in a dangerous watery, temple. They fill face foul misshapen creatures from the depths of the world and encounter a whole array of creatures, malevolent and benign. Will the party find riches and answers in this wondrous place, or will they lose their souls to despair by water’ mirror. AP1-3 is the second part of the four part adventure path, In Search Of Lost Legacy, and is suited for any rural setting in hills or woods.

Also included in “By Water’s Mirror”:

Monster: the aberrant Narenanorm
Monster variation (the harmonic mephit)
Magical Item: Sand of elemental transformation
Hints about what's to come in the ‘Search for Lost Legacy’ adventure path

178666.name: The Arbolin Tree
178666.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Arbolin Tree is the fourth in a series of one page adventures by Sacrosanct Games. They are designed with the following goals in mind:

Meant to be one-off sessions whenever something comes up that you can't do your main campaign
generic listed stats to be compatible with most versions of the most popular RPG with little conversion needed.
a quick, low prep adventure for whenever the desire to game grabs you
keep it to only one page in length for ease of use and printing

178667.name: Gulbolga's Rule
178667.description:
From publisher blurb:

Golbulga's Rule is the fifth in a series of one page adventures by Sacrosanct Games. They are designed with the following goals in mind:

Meant to be one-off sessions whenever something comes up that you can't do your main campaign
generic listed stats to be compatible with most versions of the most popular RPG with little conversion needed.
a quick, low prep adventure for whenever the desire to game grabs you
keep it to only one page in length for ease of use and printing




Note: While this adventure is one-page, a second map page has been included without the text for your players

178668.name: Cyborgs
178668.description:
From publisher blurb:

More Machine than Man!

Blurring the lines between living and machine, cybernetics grasps at the ever-complicated task of retaining humanity in the subject even as she continues to use biomechanics to alter and perfect the mortal form into which she was born. Cybernetics can be applied on a limited basis, and characters of any race or class can potentially benefit from cybertech, as described in the official Pathfinder Roleplaying Game guide to using advanced technology in a campaign. However, this book presents a brand-new class that has devoted its entire existence to selective surgery, myometric manipulation, and an almost obsessive fixation with transhumanoid evolution to become more than nature ever intended: the cyborg. Perfect for crossover campaigns where magic and technology collide, this class offers an integrated system of two dozen cybernetic modifications that combine elements of robotics and nanotechnology to stand on its own while integrating with the standard Pathfinder Roleplaying Game rules. In addition to the base class itself, you'll find rules for pseudomagical tweaks, cybernetic feats, and four new archetypes to expand your cybernetic options: the cybermancer, hunter-killer, mechlancer, and techrager!

If you are looking for terrific characters where sci-fi meets fantasy, download this 26-page product today and Make Your Game Legendary!

178669.name: Ultimate Commander
178669.description:
From publisher blurb:

Take Command!

Ultimate Commander bridges the gap between hero-level small-group adventuring and large-scale battlefield action, bringing you a brand-new character class, the general! These great leaders are capable of wielding a squad of soldiers like a living weapon, trained in complex tactics and with extraordinary acumen on the battlefield. If you've ever wanted to adventure with your own personal army at your back, this is the class for you! At the same time, the rules for this class are fully compatible with the kingdom-building and mass combat rules introduced in Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Ultimate Campaign and expanded and enriched in Ultimate Rulership, Ultimate Battle, and Ultimate War from Legendary Games!

Ultimate Commander includes an amazing array of class abilities and specialized stratagems, feats of command and leadership, and alternate favored class bonuses. It also brings you over a dozen archetypes for the general, from the criminal kingpin to radical revolutionary and the righteous redeemer to the marauding warbringer! It also presents the general's evil opposite, the hordelord, commanding a relentless zombie horde on their path of depravity! Whether your characters lead the armies of heaven or stand in the vanguard of villains, Ultimate Commander opens up a whole new route to victory and conquest! Check out this 42-page supplement and Make Your Game Legendary!

178670.description:
Channel your Fury! Barbarians wield massive weapons and their own rage to create a potent and deadly combatant. The Barbarian Class Deck accessory for the Pathfinder Adventure Card Game allows players to bring these unpredictable warriors to any Base Set, including the demon-infested Wrath of the Righteous campaign!

The 109-card Barbarian Class Deck contains three new characters—including a new version of the iconic barbarian Amiri—and both new and recognizable allies, weapons, armor, and other boons to support your barbarian through an entire Adventure Path. This deck can also be used in the popular Pathfinder Society Adventure Card Guild organized play campaign.
178670.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Class Deck – Barbarian

178671.name: Lands of Count Carmos
178671.description:
From publisher blurb:

At times adventuring groups will hit a town after a successful foray and go their separate ways for a short time. This adventure centers on such a scenario with one member opting to chase down a thief that has burgled the merchant’s guild. When checking with their cohorts the adventurer discovers they are the only one interested and, since its only one thief, the challenge should be fairly easy….right?

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for a single adventurer and DM. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

178672.name: Star Sailors: The Magical Girl Supplement for White Star RPG
178672.description:
From publisher blurb:

This supplement is designed to introduce a new player character class into your White Star campaigns. A Star Sailor is a “magical girl” trope often found in classic Japanese anime and manga, but with a science fiction twist. Star Sailors guard the universe from the evil Gloom: extra-dimensional invaders with a talent for destruction. There are new rules for character creation, mascot sidekicks, special powers and abilities as well as write-ups for several adversaries and monsters.

178673.name: The Machine Symbiont
178673.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Machine Symbiont presents an all new psychic discipline for your characters to use in Stars Without Number and other compatible OSR games.

Characters who take this power find themselves able to fix and control machines, to create their own mechanical wonders, and finally, to merge with one. Characters can now play living ships, cars, mechs and even buildings!

178674.name: Mizar Omega (Supers!)
178674.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the tradition of Metron of the Collector comes - Mizar Omega

Sometimes simply called The Broker, Mizar Omega is known for his ability to procure valuables, priceless wonders and knowledge from all corners of the universe. Devoted soley to the pursuit of knowledge - Omega has amassed one of the greatest collections of arcane knowledge, political intel, curiosities and wonders in the galaxy.

He pays well to anyone who can bring him items of interest and can be a formidable foe if someone tries to keep him from an item he wants. Mizar Omega is ready for use in your ICONS games as an ally, adversary or neutral NPC.

178675.name: The Null Sisters (Supers!)
178675.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Null Sister are an elite corps of female warriors and assasins who serve as shock troops for the servant of Darkness - Krux Morta.

Qurag is a recent addition - a shape-shifting cyborg thug who has been recruited into the leadership of the Sisters.

General Psiren is the ultimate leader of the Sister and she indoctrinates, brain-washes and trains all new recruits. Secretly, she longs to displace Morta and began the chief servant of the Greater Dark herself. She bides her time waiting for the right moment for her coup...

178676.name: No Quarter (Issue 51 - Nov 2013)
rpgissuearticle: Cover Fire: 10th Anniversary of Warmachine Art
Guts & Gears: Bull Snapper & Blackhide Wrastler
In Battle Forged: The Battle of the Thornwood
Modeling & Painting: Building a Colossal Display Base
Monsternomicon: Hollowed, Iron Maiden & Shaft Wight
The Gavyn Kyle Files: Dr. Arkadius
rpg: Iron Kingdoms Full Metal Fantasy Roleplaying Game
178676.description: Published simultaneously in print, PDF, and digital formats - contents identical.

178677.name: No Quarter (Issue 52 - Jan 2014)
rpgissuearticle: Guts & Gears: Paladins of the Order of the Wall
Modeling & Painting: For Blood or Gold
Warmachine: Tactics-How to Make a Level
rpg: Iron Kingdoms Full Metal Fantasy Roleplaying Game
178677.description: Published simultaneously in print, PDF, and electronic format. Contents identical.

178678.name: No Quarter (Issue 53 - Mar 2014)
rpgissuearticle: Iron Kingdoms Archives: The Orgoth Era
Lock & Load GameFest 2014: Up All Night
Quick Shot Scenario: Immortality Part I
Tournament Triple Threat: Legion of Everblight
Warmachine Tactics: Love and the Art of Character Construction
rpg: Iron Kingdoms Full Metal Fantasy Roleplaying Game
178678.description: Published in print, PDF, and electronic versions simultaneously. Contents are identical.

178679.name: Hatsu Koi
178679.description:
From the publisher:

Inspired by Seiji Kanai's Love Letter and the Lost Legacy games, Hatsu Koi is a microgame that follows in such gameplay traditions with beautiful anime-style artwork. Rediscover the joy of puppy love in this simple and elegant card game.

This 18-card "draw a card, play a card" microgame focuses on winning and losing. Are you lucky enough to win? Or will taking your chances lead to a broken heart?

User Summary:
Most of the 10 different abilities on the cards provide ways to win the round or cause players to be knocked out of the round. If there is no card to draw, the lowest number on the cards is the winner. Win two rounds, and you can win the game.

178680.name: No Quarter (Issue 54 - May 2014)
rpgissuearticle: Hordes: Exigence and Warmachine: Cephalyx Previews
Quick Shot Scenario: Immortality Part II
The Anastasia di Bray Files: Gavyn Kyle
Zombies Keep Out: New Ways to Play Dead
rpg: Iron Kingdoms Full Metal Fantasy Roleplaying Game
178680.description:
Published simultaneously in print, PDF, and electronic formats. Contents identical.

Note cover erroneously gives publication date as March 2014.

178681.name: No Quarter (Issue 55 - Jul 2014)
rpgissuearticle: Quick Shot Scenario: Immortality Part III
Stay Sharp: Privateer Pins Guns into Summer
With a Vengeance: New Career Options
Zombies Keep Out: Night of the Noxious Dead
rpg: Iron Kingdoms Full Metal Fantasy Roleplaying Game
178681.description: Published simultaneously in print, PDF, and electronic formats. Contents of all formats identical.

178682.name: No Quarter (Issue 56 - Aug 2014)
rpgissuearticle: Fall In: Privateer Pins' Takes Autumn by Storm
Guts & Gears: Ancestral Guardians and Immortals
Iron Kingdoms Archives: The Iron Kingdoms Era
Modeling & Painting: Slaves of the Skorne
Quick Shot Scenario: Immortality Part IV
Tournament Triple Threat: Protectorate of Menoth
rpg: Iron Kingdoms Full Metal Fantasy Roleplaying Game
178682.description:
Published simultaneously in print, PDF, and electronic formats. Contents identical.

Note cover erroneously gives publication date as March 2014.

178683.name: Uglydoll: Babo's Cookies
178683.description:
The Crazy Snatch-the-Cookies Card Game

No cookie jar is left unemptied when Babo's around, so when he opens the jar you've got to be quick to snatch a cookie before they're all gone. Join Babo and the rest of the Uglydolls in this crazy card-passing, cookie-snatching game. Collect 4 matching Uglys and you can snatch a cookie. Too slow? Well... you can eat the crumbs!

The object of the game is to be the only player who has not collected 5 Crumb Tokens. The game is played in rounds, passing cards quickly from player to player. In each round, you try to collect 4-of-a-kind of a particular Uglydoll and be the quickest to grab a cookie from the middle before they’re all gone.

178684.name: When Life Deals You Lemons
178684.description:
A thirst quenching card matching game!

When life deals you lemons, you make lemonade,of course! Collect Lemon, Water and Sugar cards to make lemonades. Make your lemonade even more delicious by adding CHERRY or LIME flavouring. Make it extra awesome by using ULTRA WATER! Serve it on a SUNNY DAY or with POPCORN! Secretly sabotage your arch-nemesis' lemonade with a sprinkling of icky YAK HAIR!

When Life Deals You Lemons is a super fun game for ages 5 and up, and was designed and drawn by Hannah (9), Miles (8) and Erica (5) Barker.

178686.name: Super Adventures
178686.description:
From the game website:
Crea il tuo supereroe in un baleno con le meccaniche di gioco semplici e flessibili di Super Adventures e gettati nella mischia!
Finalmente potrai vivere le gesta dei Supereroi dei fumetti e del cinema in un Gioco di Ruolo davvero adatto a tutti.

English translation:
Create your own superhero in a flash with the simple and flexible game mechanics of Super Adventures and thrown yourself into the fray!
Finally, you can live the adventures of comics and movies' superheroes in a Roleplay really suitable for everyone.

178687.name: Amazing Adventures The Caribbean Secret
178687.description:
Your mission: Find the lost treasure!

Search for lost treasure in the next episode of the hit hidden-object adventure series! Legend tells of a Spanish ship loaded with gold that vanished in the Caribbean Sea. Locals call this lost fortune the Caribbean Secret. Your mission is to find the golden treasure!

Explore 25 exotic locations as you traverse the tropical islands. Find over 2,000 cleverly hidden objects in over 100 levels and track down clues to the missing fortune. Will you find the legendary cache of gold?

FEATURES

• Find over 2,000 hidden objects in over 100 levels.
• Explore 25 exotic Caribbean locations.
• Play three ways: Find the Secret Treasure, Unlimited Seek & Find and Unlimited Match-3.
• Find all the hidden skulls to unlock Unlimited game modes.
• Play 8 unique mini-games including Match-3, Word Search and many more.
• Play against the clock or in Relaxed mode with no time limits.
• Learn interesting facts as you complete your missions!

Source: The Publisher Website.

178688.name: Dicetopia
178688.description:
The neon-clad city of Dicetopia lies before you. A seething cauldron of petty thieves, devious corporations and ruthless smugglers. Or in other words, the city of opportunity for you and your factions highly questionable motives!

Unleash your agents to take over neighbourhoods, snatch loot, perform shifty actions and carry out sneaky missions. Be the unbridled predator, you’ve hopefully never dreamt of being in real life, and lay the city before your feet!

Dicetopia is a quick strategic board game for 2-4 players with a playtime of 20-30 minutes. The game introduces a fresh mix of area control, dice manipulation, worker placement and secret objectives. On players turn they will send out one of their agents to a neighbourhood in the city. This single move will determine the resource they’ll collect, their control of that neighbourhood, and what action they’ll perform.

When all agents has been deployed after 6 rounds, the ultimate goal is to score the highest points based on the neighbourhoods players dominates, the die resources they have, and from their secret missions.

The game has a randomized setup and comes with 10 different factions, 40 unique missions and 10 game changing scenarios to make sure no game ever feel the same!

178689.description:
Mongols : La Grande Chevauchée (1194-1294) is a solitaire wargame simulating the Mongol expansion from 1194, when Gengis Khan becomes the chief of principal Mongol clans, to 1294, death of his grandson Kubilaï Khan.

The map displays the historical area of Mongol conquest till the end of XIIIe century, from Europe to the Sea of China and the Indian Ocean, from the Scandinavia to the lands of Egypt and Arabia.

1 turn - 10 years
1cm - 200km
324 counters
1 map (two piece) 56.6cmx40cm

The game lasts 10 turns
178689.name: Mongols: La Grande Chevauchée (1194-1294)

178690.name: Sine Requie Anno XIII: Il Trono del Crisantemo
178690.description:
From the publisher website:
Il 6 Giugno 1944 lo spirare del Kamikaze permise allo Yomi di divorare il mondo dei viventi.
Ogni nazione conosciuta crollò sotto l'impeto degli Shiryo e del loro Dolore senza fine, che li spingeva a divorare gli uomini per riappropriarsi della vita persa.

English translation:
1944, 6th of June, the expirationblow of the Kamikaze allowed the Yomi to devour the world of the living.
Every nation known collapsed under the impetus of Shiryo and their endless pain, which prompted them to devour men to regain lost life.

178691.name: Sine Requie Anno XIII: Regno di Osiride
178691.description:
From the publisher website:
Il 6 giugno 1944 Ramesse III liberò se stesso e i suoi sudditi dalla schiavitù della morte. Adesso è il 1957, il Regno di Osiride è una nazione potente e magnifica, nella quale i vivi e Morti servono il Dio incarnato con cieca venerazione e ogni incubo sembra dissolversi al cospetto delle acque del Nilo.

English translation:
1944, 6th of June, Ramesses III freed himself and his people from the slavery of death. Now it's 1957, the Kingdom of Osiris is a strong and magnificent nation, in which the living and the Dead serve the incarnate God with blind reverence and every nightmare seems to dissolve in the presence of the Nile waters.

178692.name: Sine Requie Anno XIII: L'Urlo dell'Abisso
178692.description:
From the publisher website:
Avete conosciuto l’orrore di Sine Requie Anno XIII e l’inferno sovietico creato da Z.A.R.!
Adesso avete la possibilità di vivere quell’incubo nel ruolo di operai, soldati, gladiatori.

English translation:
You have experienced the horror of Sine Rest Year XIII and hell created by Soviet ZAR!
Now you have the opportunity to live this nightmare in the role of workers, soldiers, gladiators.

178693.name: Sine Requie Anno XIII: Vodzene
178693.description:
From the publisher website:
Avete conosciuto l’orrore di Sine Requie Anno XIII e l’inferno sovietico creato da Z.A.R.!
Adesso avete la possibilità di vivere quell’incubo nel ruolo di operai: la base del valoroso sistema sovietico.

English translation:
You have experienced the horror of Sine Rest Year XIII and hell created by Soviet ZAR!
Now you have the opportunity to live this nightmare in the role of workers: the base of the valiant Soviet system

178694.name: Sine Requie Anno XIII: Soviet
178694.description:
From the back of the book:
Avete conosciuto l’orrore di Sine Requie Anno XIII e l’inferno Il 6 Giugno 1944 il mondo sprofondò nel più oscuro degli inferni. Nel Giorno del Giudizio i Morti iniziarono la caccia al genere umano.
English translation:
On June 6, 1944, the world sank into the darkest of hells. On Judgment Day the Dead began hunting mankind.

178695.name: Memoria Myrana (Issue 22 - May 2009)
178695.description:
3 - Vorwort - Horstmann
4 – Land der 10000 Götter - Von geheimen Kulten in Myranor Alex Spohr
10 – Leben in Myranor - Die Wegstation LXI Florian Wassermann
17 – Die Philosophie der Shingwa Dennis Rüter
21 – Von der Zeitmessung in MyranorDennis Rüter, Jochen Willmann
26 – Myranische Magie - Der neristische Thulna’il Thomas Bemberg, Daridoria
34 – Beispielgenerierung: Kouramnion-Optimat Christian Saßenscheidt
38 - Myranische Rezepte - Ama GirRaos Kochecke: Brajans und Sumus Entzücken Corinna Kersten
39 – Myranor Szene - Roleplay-Convention in Köln Peter Horstmann
41 – Rassen & Kulturen - Kizne – Das Fuchsvolk I Janine Radeke, Enrico Schnick, Lorinn de Loc
51 Impressum
52 Comic
53 Wettbewerb-Ausschreibung

178696.name: Love & Laughter: The Game of Smiles
178696.description:
The invitation of color pedagogue Frederike Herrlich makes a playful way a new approach to themselves and others, by the freedom of choice. Regardless of gender, age, culture and religion. Knowledge and personal experiences of individuals are recognized and contribute to original answers to philosophical questions at: not whether, but how we want. Or would you prefer to relax?
The game board shows a path to move which is built out of 3 circled which have field where the pawn can move from one to another circle.
Their are 4 kinds of event fields (drivem by Cards):

2 types: Inform about something about his person or his life
Opening a discussion about an issue
ColourChild: Define parts of yourself with colours, based on the colour psychology




Each player has a pawn moving on a path of the board, dice role driven.
Game ends when 1 player has finished his colour child. All other Players are allowed to finish also their colour child.

178697.name: Sine Requie Anno XIII: Tomo dei Morti Volume I
178697.description:
From the back of the book:
Queste pagine raccolgono segreti e testimonianze sui più terribili orrori partoriti dal Giorno del Giudizio: i Morti.
English translation:
These pages collect intelligence and evidence on the most terrible horrors born from the Day of Judgment: the Dead.

178698.name: Sine Requie Anno XIII: U.S.A.
178698.description:
From the back of the book:
Il 6 Giugno 1944 i Morti trascinarono il mondo nel più oscuro degli inferni. Nel Giorno dei Tre Soli New York e Washington D.C. vennero rase al suolo dalla potenza delle bombe atomiche.
English translation:
The June 6, 1944 the Dead dragged the world into the darkest of hells. On the Day of the Three Suns New York and Washington DC were razed to the ground by the power of the atomic bombs.

178699.name: Memoria Myrana (Issue 23 - Aug 2009)
rpgissuearticle: Die Menschen und Amaunir von Rhacornos
178699.description:
3 Vorwort - Horstmann
4 – Leben in Myranor - Castra Montana Florian Wassermann
14 – Myranische Magie - Die Macht der Zeit Dennis Rüter
22 – Myranische Rezepte - Ama GirRaos Kochecke: Menü aus Siminiafrüchten Corinna Kersten
24 – Myranor Szene - Myraniare vor Ort: FeenCon 2009Peter Horstmann, Christian Gaertner
27 – Rassen & Kulturen - Kizne – Das Fuchsvolk II Janine Radeke, Enrico Schnick, Lorinn de Loc
40 – Die Menschen und Amaunir von Rhacornos Dennis Rüter
44 – Abenteur und Szenarien - Im Dienst des Ridor Murta Alex Spohr
52 Impressum
53 Back Cover

178700.name: Sine Requie Anno XIII: IV Reich
178700.description:
From the back of the book:
Il 6 Giugno 1944 il mondo sprofondò nel più oscuro degli inferni. Nel Giorno del Giudizio i Morti iniziarono la caccia contro il genere umano.
Adesso è il 1957, il IV Reich governato dai Quadrunviri domina su gran parte dell’Europa centrale, tentando di schiacciare tutto ciò che gli si oppone.
English translation:
On June 6, 1944, the world sank into the darkest of hells. On Judgment Day the Dead began hunting against mankind.
Now it's 1957, the IV Reich ruled by Quadrunviri dominates much of central Europe, trying to crush everything that stands in its way.

rpgseries: RPG Geek Fiasco Playset Contest 2015: Mythical / Supernatural
178701.name: Wash Your Sins
178701.description:
Publisher Blurb

A group of Finnish soldiers returning from yet another Russo-Swedish War in the late 1500s stumble into a village that isn't on the maps. Originally settled by pilgrims, who believed the local spring had the ability to clean them of their sins, the village is now occupied by people with very dark pasts.

They have built a sauna next to the spring to better facilitate their purification, but everyone still seems haunted by their pasts.

As one of the soldiers, your deeds during the war weigh heavily on your soul. Maybe you can't sleep or maybe the apparitions of your victims are always there in your peripheral vision. This may be your last chance for a fresh start.

Or maybe it's just a ploy of the devil to claim a few more weak individuals.

178702.name: Sine Requie Anno XIII: Gli Occhi del Serpente
178702.description:
From the back of the book:
Unisciti all'inquisizione in una lunga e pericolosa indagine che ti porterà dalle grandi città ai paesi più isolati del Sanctum Imperium, nel tentativo di sventare un culto blasfemo
English translation:
Join the Inquisition in a long and dangerous investigation that takes you from the big cities to the most isolated countries in the Sanctum Imperium, in an attempt to foil a blasphemous worship

178703.name: Memoria Myrana (Issue 24 - Nov 2009)
rpgissuearticle: Es liest sich was V: Hjaldinger-Saga II: Sturm
178703.description:
3 - Vorwort - Horstmann
4 – Myranische Rezepte - Ama GirRaos Kochecke: Siminiafrüchtekuchen Corinna Kersten
6 – Rezensionen & Kommentare - Es liest sich was V: Hjaldinger-Saga II: Sturm Dennis Rüter
8 – Myranor Abenteuer - Der Papyrus der Sonnenschlangen René Littek
11 - Stadt & Region - Von der Größe des LandesDennis Rüter
12 – Wege nach Myranor: Sphärentunnel Jochen Willmann, Jürgen Roth
18 – Rassen & Kulturen - Quaddros Dennis Rüter
22 – Myranor Abenteuer - Von Schlangen und Katzen Alex Spohr
36 - Impressum
37 – Myranische Magie - Zauberbogen
40 - Back Cover

178704.name: Sine Requie Anno XIII: Terre Perdute
178704.description:
From the back of the book:
Il 6 Giugno 1944 il mondo sprofondò nel più oscuro degli inferni. Nel Giorno del Giudizio i Morti iniziarono la caccia contro il genere umano.
Adesso è il 1957, le nazioni non sottoposte a crudeli regimi dittatoriali sono collassate, schiacciate dalla Fame insensata dei Morti.
English translation:
On June 6, 1944, the world sank into the darkest of hells. On Judgment Day the Dead began hunting against mankind.
Now it's 1957, the nations not subjected to cruel dictatorships have collapsed, crushed by senseless Hunger of the Dead.

178705.name: Sine Requie Anno XIII: Olocausto di Terrore
178705.description:
From the back of the book:
Olocausto di Terrore contiene quattro avventure dell?orrore basate sul mondo di Sine Requie, quattro deliranti incubi per mettere alla prova la scaltrezza e il coraggio dei vostri Personaggi.
English translation:
Holocaust Terror contains four adventures of? Horror based on the world of Sine Requie, four delirious nightmares to test the smartness and courage of your characters.

178706.name: Sine Requie Anno XIII: Schermo del Cartomante
178706.description:
From the publisher website:
Schermo a quattro ante in cartoncino rigido, contenente le tabelle più importanti del gioco di ruolo Sine Requie Anno XIII.
English translation:
Screen with four pages of stiff cardboard, containing the most important tables of RPG Sine Rest XIII.

178707.description: Seas of Iron: Rising Sun is the first expansion for the popular battleship combat game Seas of Iron. Rising Sun is a stand alone game that is also 100% compatible with Seas of Iron. The new game includes the addition of Aircraft Carriers, Fighters and new crew members.
178707.name: Seas of Iron Rising Sun

178708.name: Memoria Myrana (Issue 25 - Feb 2010)
178708.description:
3 - Vorwort - Horstmann
4 – Myranische Rezepte - Ama GirRaos Kochecke: Schmugglerfleisch Corinna Kersten
6 – Rezensionen & Kommentare - Spieletestbericht: Verschwunden in Sidor Damenios Alex Spohr
9 – Stadt & Region - Von den Cirkeln der Müllsammler - Dennis Rüter
16 - Die Tanginsel Xai-Maqkar Jan Stawarz
27 – Alogoia – Stadt deer Pferdegöttin Peter Horstmann
30 – Land der 10000 Götter - Equona Peter Horstmann
32 – Abenteur und Szenarien - Sklaven des Windes Dennis Rüter
53 – Vorschau auf Kommende Myranor-Produkte - Myranische Götter – Der “Götterband” Peter Horstmann, Jörg Raddatz
56 Impressum
57 Back Cover

178709.name: Chain of Nations
178709.description:
The board shows 100 fields (10x10) which show 50 Muslim counties (each 2 times).
Each player has 3 to 7 country cards on his hand (dependent on number of players).
On Players turn he Plays one of his Cards and places one of his Stone on one of the 2 fields with the same country.
The choosen field has to be empty. If this is not possible he can choose any free field.
The first player (or team) which has first 5 markers in a line (horizontal, vertical or diagonal) wins.
The game is designed for maximum 12 players in maximum 4 teams.

178710.name: Tasty Tower: Squishy's Revenge
178710.description:
Squishy has a serious craving for sweets! The only way he can get them is with your help.

This round happy little blob is hungry for your help, and for cupcakes! Help him climb to new heights of sweetness in Tasty Tower. Guide our plumb hero up and past spikes and the evil wee’s whilst making sure he gets enough to eat, be careful though it’s a long way down!

Seventy levels of tasty goodness, with seven different colourful and exciting worlds to explore and discover!

Features:
– Delicious graphics
– Easy to play, tricky to master
– 70 levels to nom your way though
– 7 different worlds to explore!
– Survival mode to satisfy your highscore sweet-tooth
– Unlock new tasty outfits for Squishy
– Rainbow blast power ups and more

Source: The Publisher Website.

178711.name: The Path
178711.description:
Game of Life with an Islamic theme.

Easy rules: The player who collects the most Good Deeds and builds the largest Family wins the game.
Advanced rules: The player who collects the most Good Deeds (in Gold), the best Career, the best Cars. the best House and can completely fill out any sections of the Personal Player Card wins the game.
All these things are marked with collecting special tiles. For getting the different tiles the player has to hit Special fields for collecting, changing or trading the things.
The movement of the pawns is driven by Spinning a Move Spinner.

178712.name: Tower Dwellers
178712.description:
A unit crafting tower defence game.

Conquer through battle and reclaim the land you once called home!

• Craft Units from each tower to build a strategic army
• Command your units in Real Time and assist them in battle with your magic spells
• Non-linear progression – decide which territory to conquer next based on the upgrades it unlocks
• Complete the hilariously narrated tale to regain a land once lost
• Perfect your strategy by staging battles in the encyclopedia sandbox mode

Source: The Publisher Website.

178713.name: Joinz
178713.description:
Joinz is a clever block sliding puzzle game that is easy to play, nice to look at but tricky to master. You will be coming back again and again to try and beat your high score or top your friends on the leaderboard.

Joinz is an endless puzzle game where you must slide like colored blocks together to create the requested “tetris-like” shapes. The more shapes you create, the more points you get. Only like colors can be joined together and each time you do not join blocks, a new one enters the playing board. Earn unique power ups to help clear the board and use combos to help boost your high score.

Source: The Publisher Website.

178714.name: Hungry Froo
178714.description:
Meet Hungry Froo! The cutest monster on the app store with a BIG appetite. A great physics puzzle game for all ages!

Use the simple touch controls to launch moon rocks into the trees to drop all the delicious fruit to the ground for Froo to eat.

Be sure to aim carefully. Froo doesn’t want any of the rotten fruit and there are many challenging obstacles to avoid and puzzles to solve.

Features:
– 4 Packs
– 128 Levels
– Clever Physic Puzzles
– Great For All Ages
– Game Center Leaderboard and Acheiveents

Source: The Publisher Website.

178715.name: Hilfsconvoy nach Rumänien
178715.description:
The Story behind of this dice driven game is the truck convoy to Romanian orphanages.
The board game shows multiple tracks from Germany to Romainia.
There are many different Action fields.
Some of them you need to hit, e.g. phone, gas station in each country and Orphanage in Romainia. On some fields you can upgrade your convoy. New truck, new trailer, good storage.
Some event fields (Cardstocks for the different contries), negativ event fields e.g. boarder control (user has to stop here, except he got a special card to move on.
The player wins, whos convoy has deliveres goods to 2 orphanages in Romainia and Comes first back to Germany.

178718.name: Auf den Spuren  des Völkerapostels Paulus
178718.description:
The game plays at the time of the live of Paulus.

The board Shows the east Mediterranean Sea, square fields are marked. There are cities (numbered) on the board, which where visited by Paulus.

At the begin of the game 6 city cards are drawn, sorted by number (lowest on top) and placed on the board.

The Paulus pawn is placed on the city of the Card with the lowest number.
3 additional Cards are placed right to the city Card series.
A neutral pawn is placed on a path at the edge of the board. This path Shows fields with the numbers 1 to 3 and fields with P.
On a player's turn he rolls the die, moves the neutral pawn this number and normally gets the number of Cards the field shows.
The player can choose freely if he wants to get person cards or good cards.
